loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à TIBINA un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame NIOGO débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme BENKADI 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 2 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who are on average 36 years old with three children. Most of them live in traditional families in Tibina, a village in the Lobougoula commune in the Sikasso circle of the third administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institute in order to manage their farming affairs during the winter.
This is their tenth agricultural loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, the previous loans were repaid correctly.
Mrs. Niogo, who is standing second from the left in the group of Benkadi 2 women in the photo, grows groundnuts.
With her loan she plans to buy two sacks of 50 kg of fertilizer, two cans of weed killer, and to pay for labour costs for 0.75 hectares.
After harvesting, she sells the production in her village, in Sikasso, to a mixed clientele for cash and for credit.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA per field.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan with the interests and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertiliser, weed killer,and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Sinignessigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, ont en moyenne 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOROBARRAGE un village dans la commune de KOUORO dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame AFOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SINIGNESSIGUI 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 61 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sinignessigui 1 group are married women, who average 43 years of age and have an average of six children each; the majority of them live in traditional families in Korobarrage, a village in the Kouoro commune in the Sikasso circle (Mali's third administrative region).

They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to carry out their farming activities successfully during the winter season, and they are on their fourth seasonal loan with the institution; the previous loans have all been repaid in full.

Afou, who is standing second from the left in the photo of the Sinignessigui 1 group of women, grows groundnut. With her loan she is planning to buy a 50 kilo sack of fertilizer, a container of weed killer, and also pay for labor to maintain 0,5 hectares of land. 

Once harvested, the produce is sold in the village in Sikasso to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash and on credit.

Afou expects to make an average profit of 61,000FCFA per season. This will enable her to repay her loan and the interest on it, and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and weed killers and tp pay for labor.

loans.name: Joli Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe JOLI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame ADAM  débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes JOLI , fait la restauration.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 2 sacs de 50 kg de riz, 10 paquets de cube maggi, 1 panier 50 kg de pomme de terre, 1 sac de sel, plus divers condiments pour la bonne cuisine au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits.
La vente se fait en détail dans sa restaurant à SANOUBOUGOU II à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group called Joli are married women with an average age of 34 and have on average two children. They mostly live in traditional families in Sanoubougou II, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They are on their seventh solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of their clientele. 

Madame Adam, the second woman standing from left to right in the photo of the members of Joli Group, sells cooked food. She intends to use her loan to buy two sacks of 50 kg of rice, 10 packages of Maggi cubes, one 50 kg basket of potatoes, one sack of salt and various condiments to make good food at the big market, where she is much in demand with her clientele, thanks to the quality of her products. 

Her sales are made retail in her restaurant in Sanoubougou II, her clientele being composed of men and women, with sales for cash or credit. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, of which one part will be used to repay the loan and interest, and the other part put aside as savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, and condiments for  food cooked for resale

loans.name: Tioumoutie 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe TIOUMOUTIE 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZIASSO un village dans la commune de LOBOUGOULA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame TINTIO assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme TIOUMOUTIE 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called Tioumoutie 4 are married women with an average age of 32. They have on average three children and live mostly in traditional families in Ziasso, a village in the community of Lobougoula, Sikasso Circle, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their 11th seasonal loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Their prior loans have been correctly reimbursed. 

Madame Tintio, first woman sitting on her heels, right to left in the photo of the group, grows peanuts. With her loan she intends to buy one sack of 50 kg of fertilizer and one tin of herbicide and pay the labor costs to maintain 0.5 hectares. After the harvest, her produce is sold right in the village and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and credit. She expects to make an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and the interest and to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides and pay for labor

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe  JIGUIYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  SANOUBOUGOU II un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  KADIATOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes JIGUIYA, fait la vente des pommes de terre .
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 8 paniers de100 kg de pomme de terre au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
La vente se fait en détail  à SANOUBOUGOU II à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the group JIGUIYA are married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in SANOUBOUGOU II, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they are on their ninth solidarity loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customer.

Ms. KADIATOU, who is sitting in the middle in the photo in this women’s group JIGUIYA, sells potatoes. With her loan, she intends to purchase eight 100-kg baskets of potatoes at the big market, where she is much in demand by her customers for the quality of her products. Her sales are made in SANOUBOUGOU II to men and women customers paying with cash or credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will in part be used to pay back the loan with interest. The other part will go toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 52 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANGOULA MARKALA, un des villages de la commune de NAMPASSO cercle de BLA de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et arachide  avec NANA,  1ère femme assise de la droite vers  la  gauche   sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à BLA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 52 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in traditional families in Sangoula Markala, one of the villages in the commune of Nampasso, Bla Circle, in the 4th administrative district of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the institution. Their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Nana, sitting on the right in the picture, grows rice and groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in the Bla region to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 145 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the labourer's wages and to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Madame MARIAM est née en aoùt 1968 à TENINKOU région de MOPTI, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, réside sous couvert de son époux dans une famille traditionnelle à DOGONI une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI.
Elle collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son activité agricole pendant l’hivernage. 
Elle est à son troisième prêt de production de maïs avec l’Institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs , ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 20 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 30 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 4 hectares.
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 720 000 francs CFA par campagne.Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Ms. Mariam was born in August, 1968 in Teninkou in the region of Mopti.  She is married, mother of six children, and lives with her spouse in a traditional family in Dogoni, in the Sikasso commune, the third largest administrative region in the republic of Mali.  She is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out her farming business during the rainy season.  She is on her third loan for corn production with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans have been fully repaid.  She grows corn and this loan will enable her to buy 20 50-kg bags of fertilizer, 30 containers of different herbicides, and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining four hectares.  After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele of men and women, for cash and credit.  She expects to earn an average profit of 720,000 francs CFA per season.  This profit will enable her to repay her loan, the interest, and to contribute to her family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Kotognontala 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZOUMAYERE une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame ROKIA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KOTOGNONTALA 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Kotognontala 2 Group are married women with an average age of 37 and an average of five children each. The majority of them live within traditional family frameworks in Zoumayere, a commune in Sikasso Cercle, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their eleventh farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with whom their previous loans were paid back in full.

Rokia, the woman standing at the end of the back row to the right-hand side of this photo of the Kotognontala 2 Group, grows peanuts. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing three 50-kg sacks of fertiliser and three cans of herbicide, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain 0.75 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold on a village level in Sikasso to a customer base made up of both men and women, accepting cash and credit as payment. She is planning on making a profit of 105,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow her to pay off the loan and its interest and help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, fertiliser and herbicides

loans.name: Moukahirou

texts.fr:
Monsieur MOUKAHIROU est né en Janvier 1967 à SAMOGOSSONI C/SIKASSO, marié, père de 9 enfants et il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à SAMOGOSSONI un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI.
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son activité agricole pendant l’hivernage. 
Il est à son premier prêt de campagne avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso.  
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs , ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 16 sacs de 50 kg d’anglais, 16 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 4 hectares.
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 680 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son interêt, contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Mr Moukahirou was born in January, 1967 in Samogossoni, Sikasso.  He is married, father of nine children, and lives with his spouse in a traditional family in Samogossoni, a village in the Sikasso commune, the third largest administrative region in the republic of Mali.  He is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out his farming business during the rainy season.  He is on his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. He grows corn and this loan will enable him to buy 16 50-kg bags of fertilizer, 16 containers of different herbicides, and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining four hectares.  After the harvest, the output is sold at the village level in Sikasso to a clientele of men and women, for cash and credit.  He expects to earn an average profit of 680,000 francs CFA per season.  This profit will enable him to repay his loan, the interest, and to contribute to his family's household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à SANGOULA MARKALA, un des villages de la commune de NAMPASSO cercle de BLA de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et arachide  avec FATOUMATA,  1ère femme assise de la droite vers  la  gauche   sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à BLA, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 146 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women with an average age of 30 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in traditional families in Sangoula Markala, one of the villages in the commune of Nampasso, Bla Circle, in the 4th administrative district of Mali. They are working with the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the institution. Their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Fatoumata, sitting on the right in the picture, grows rice and groundnuts. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small agricultural equipment, and to pay the wages of the labourers needed to maintain 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and in the Bla region to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 146 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the labourers' wages and to buy agricultural inputs, seeds and small equipment.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Monsieur YAYA est né en juin 1975 à KADONBOUGOU C/SIKASSO, marié et père de 4 enfants,  il réside avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à HAMDALLAYE un quartier populaire dans la ville de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI.
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son activité agricole pendant l’hivernage. 
Il est à son quatrième prêt de campagne avec l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso, le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursé.  
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs , ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 8 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 8 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 2 hectares.
Après la récolte la production est vendue à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 280 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Yaya was born in June 1975 in Kadonbougu, the district of Sikasso. He is married and the father of four. He lives with his wife in the traditional extended family in Hamdallaye,  a modest neighborhood in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.
 He collaborates with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage his agricultural business during the rainy season.
 He is on his fourth agricultural loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, having duly repaid his prior loan[s].
 He grows corn. This loan will allow him to buy  eight 50-kg kg [110 lbs] bags of fertilizers, eight jugs of herbicides of various quality grade and pay the cost of labor to work 2 ha [4 acres] of land. 

 After harvesting, he sells his produce in Sikasso to a mixed clientele, for cash and on credit.
He plans to earn an average revenue of 280,000 West African francs per agricultual campaign.
This revenue will allow him to pay of his loan with interesting and contribute to the everyday family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides as well as cover the costs of labor.

loans.name: Kotognontala 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à ZOUMAYERE une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec madame NASSOU débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  KOTOGNONTALA 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 3 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 3 bidons d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0, 75 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten member of the group KOTOGNONTALA 1 are married women, who average 41 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in Commune de ZOUMAYERE, in Cercle de Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their eleventh farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. NASSOU, who is standing second from the left in the photo of this women’s group KOTOGNONTALA 1. With her loan, she intends to purchase three 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and three containers of herbicide and to pay for plowing to maintain 0.75 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan with interest and also to help her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

Elles sont à leur 2ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’ arachide  avec  KAYATA , femme assise au milieu  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à TOMINIAN, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 120 .000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women who are of an average age of 39 with six children. They all live in traditional families in Kancene, one of the villages in the Tominian commune in Tominian circle, in the fourth administrative region of Mali.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in order to manage their agricultural activities during the winter.
This is their second loan from the institution, the previous loan was correctly repaid.
Kayata, the woman sitting in the middle of the photo, grows groundnut.
With her loan she plans to buy farming products, seeds, and small farming tools and pay labour costs for the upkeep of one hectare.
After the harvest, she sells the production in her village and in Tominian to a mixed clientele.
She hopes to make an average profit of 120.000FCFA at the end of the season.
This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertiliser and weed killer, seeds, labour costs, and small farming tools.

Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec SALI ADAMA N°2,  1ème femme assise de    la droite vers  la gauche    sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,5  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à SAN, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten member of the group WEYETIE 6 are married women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. The women all live in traditional families in KOROMOROSSO, a village in Commune de KAVA, Cercle de SAN (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is:  peanuts, as is the case with Ms. SALI ADAMA N°2, who is the first woman sitting at the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, farming equipment, and plowing to maintain: 0.5 hectare. 

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and in SAN. She plans on making an average profit of 85,000 francs CFA at the end of the planting season. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, equipment, and seeds

loans.name: Kouloudouma Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Kouloudouma vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Médine l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (la 3eme femme arrêtée de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  un sac d’ognon 10 kg de tomate dans le marché de Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit au marché de Ségou et la maison à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Fatoumata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer le partenariat  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women who make up the Kouloudouma group all live in monogamous families. On average, they are 35 years old and have two children each. They all live in Médine, one of the neighborhoods of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through neighborhood, kinship and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are involved in small retail, selling condiments, clothes, and prepared meals. In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their second cycle of solidarity loan.

Fatoumata, standing third from the left, is a major seller of various condiments in and around her neighborhood.  She is planning to use her loan to buy one bag of onions as well as ten kilos of tomatoes at a market in Ségou.  She sells her goods to both men and women, from home and at the Ségou market.  Her customers pay her in cash and also often on credit. 

Fatoumata is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to help her husband and also to increase her own business. She wants to continue her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Weyetie  9 Group

texts.fr:
Les  5  membres du groupe  WEYETIE  9  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3  enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOROMOROSSO, un des villages de la commune de KAVA cercle de SAN  de la  4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le mil  avec MINATA VIEUX,   femme assise au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 1  hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à SAN, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 138 000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the WEYETIE 9 group are married women and they are, on average, 34 years old with three children each. They all live in traditional families in Koromorosso, a village located in the commune of Kava, Cercle of San (fourth administrative region of Mali). They work with Kiva's partner, the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Minata Vieux, a member of the group, is a millet farmer. In the photo, she is the only woman in the front row. She is planning to use her loan to buy some agricultural inputs, seeds, small farming equipment, and also to cover her plowing costs to maintain one hectare of land. After the harvest, she will sell her crop to male and female customers in her village and in San. She is expecting to make an average profit of 138,000 CFA francs at the end of the planting season. She will use her profit to repay her loan and to help her husband with the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to cover her plowing costs and buy agricultural inputs, small farming equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Tiessiri 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Tiessiri 1  sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Siradjankoro, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame Sirantou (la 2ème  femme debout de la droite vers la gauche  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Siradjankoro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de Siradjankoro et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari pour le bien être de leur  famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the Tiessiri 1 group are all married and living in traditional families. They average 33 years of age with four children each, and all live in the village of Siradjankoro in the Ségou region (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). They got to know each other through their winter farming activities, as neighbors, and through marriage and relatives in the village. They grow groundnut, millet, beans, fonio and rice. With a view to buying small materials, seeds, agricultural inputs and to paying for labor for the hoeing of the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third seasonal loan.

Sirantou (who is standing second from the right in the photo) has a large winter farming activity in the village of Siradjankoro, and she is planning to use her loan to buy seeds, agricultural inputs and small materials in the village, as well as to pay youths to hoe her field. She sells her farming produce for cash at the end of the winter season, so that she can repay her loan and have enough income to provide for her own needs as well as her childrens'; part of the income is used to help her husband ensure the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds and agricultural inputs, as well as to pay for labor for the hoeing of the fields.

loans.name: Yeredeme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Yeredeme 1, sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Fanzana, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Mah (la 3ème  femme debout de la  gauche vers la  droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Fanzana. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de  Fanzana, de Ségou  et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Yeredeme 1 are all married in traditional families. On average they are 36 years old with three children. They all live in Fanzana, a village in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).
They met through their winter farming activities, neighbourhood ties and family and marital ties in the village. They grow groundnuts, millet, beans, fonio and rice. Hoping to be able to purchase small tools, seeds, products for the earth and to pay for labour costs for hoeing the land, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their fourth agricultural loan.
Mrs. Mah, (the third woman standing from left to right in the photo) is very busy with her winter farming activities in Fanzana village. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds, agricultural products and small equipment in Fanzana, Segou, and also to pay young people to hoe her field. She sells her produce for cash at the end of the winter to repay her loan, and in order to have enough income to cover petty necessities for her children and a part of it to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy seeds, agricultural products and small equipment and to pay for labour costs for hoeing the land.

Madame   Oumou   Bourama      (la 1ère  femme debout de la gauche   vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Siradjankoro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles au village de Siradjankoro et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants et une partie de la famille.

Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame   Binta  (la 1ère  femme debout de la gauche   vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Siradjankoro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles au village de Siradjankoro et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants et une partie de la famille.
texts.en:
The six women of the Tiessiri 5 group are all married in traditional families. On average they are 26 years old with two children. They all live in Siradjankoro, a village in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the republic of Mali).
They met through their winter farming activities, neighbourhood ties and family and marital ties in the village. They grow groundnuts, millet, corn, and rice. In order to facilitate the purchase of small tools, seeds, products for the earth and to pay for labour costs for hoeing the land, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their third agricultural loan.
Mrs. Binta, (the first woman standing from left to right in the photo) is very busy with winter farming activities in Siradjankoro village. She intends to use her loan to buy seeds and agricultural products in the village, and also to pay young people to hoe her field. She sells her produce for cash at the end of the winter to repay her loan, and in order to have enough income to cover the petty necessities of her children and part of her family.

loans.use: To buy small tools, seeds, and products for the earth and to pay for labour costs for hoeing the land.

loans.name: Kounawolo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Kounawolo vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Siribougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font  la restauration et le petit commerce de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  15eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djelika (la 1ere femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette à sauce dans le village et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de riz chez les stockeurs du village de konodimini. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison et le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djelika  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 35 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer le partenariat  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Kounawolo all live in traditional families, and they average 41 years of age and six children each, all living in the village of Siribougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the village. They work in food service and do commerce in condiments. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifteenth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Djelika (the first woman sitting at the right in the photo) is a major vendor of galettes served with sauce in and around the village. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice from warehouses in the village of Konodimini. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash and often on credit at her house and at the market. 

With this loan, Ms. Djelika hopes to make an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used in part to support the family and also to grow her business capital. She hopes to continue the partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase rice for her restaurant

loans.name: 08 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hồng is 43 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hồng is the group leader of the 08 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members.

In 2012, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nissondiya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Nissondiya 1, sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de  Daoulabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Djeneba (la 1ère  femme baissée de la  gauche  vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Daoulabougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de  Daoulabougou  et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari pour le bien être de leur  famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Nissondiya 1 are all married in traditional families. The women average 39 years of age and four children each, all living in the village of Daoulabougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community, marriage, kinship, and their rainy-season farm work in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, beans, fonio [an ancient type of millet], and rice. 

With the goal of paying for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and labor to weed the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Djeneba (the first women hunched over at the left in the photo) is a major manager of rainy-season farming in the village of Daoulabougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and tools in the village of Daoulabougou and also to pay young people to weed her field. 

The sales of her produce are made in cash transactions at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan and finally to obtain the revenues to cover the sundry needs of her children; and part is for helping her husband for the well-being of their family.

loans.use: to pay for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and the labor for weeding feeds

loans.name: Nissondiya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Nissondiya 2, sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Daoulabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Sitan  (la 2ème  femme baissée de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de  Daoulabougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de konodimini et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari pour le bien être de leur  famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Nissondiya 2 are all married in traditional families. The women average 28 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Daoulabougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community, marriage, kinship, and their rainy-season farm work in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, beans, fonio [an ancient type of millet], and rice. 

With the goal of paying for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and labor to weed the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sitan (the second women hunched over at the left in the photo) is a major leader of rainy-season farming in the village of Daoulabougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and tools in the village of Daoulabougou and also to pay young people to weed her field. 

The sales of her produce are made in cash transactions at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan and finally to obtain the revenues to cover the sundry needs of her children; and part is for helping her husband for the well-being of their family.

loans.use: to pay for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and the labor for weeding feeds

loans.name: Yeredeme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Yeredeme 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Fanzana, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame   Fatoumata   (la 1ère  femme debout de la droite  vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Fanzana. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de  Fanzana, de Ségou  et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari.
texts.en:
The six women in the Yeredeme 3 group are all married into traditional families. They are, on average, 36 years old and have three children. They all live in Fanzana, in the Segou region (in the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other from their farming during the rainy season, and from neighborhood, marriage, and family ties in the village.

The women in this group grow groundnuts, millet, beans, fonio, and rice.

With the goal of buying small equipment, seeds, and farm inputs, and to pay the cost of weeding the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fourth loan.

Fatoumata (the first woman standing on the right in the photo) is a leader of the rainy season farming in Fanzana. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds, farm inputs, and small equipment in Fanzana, and to pay some young people to weed her field.

Sales of the crops will be made for cash at the end of the rainy season. Earnings will be used to pay back her loan, take care of her children's small needs, and help her husband.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds, and farm inputs, and to pay the cost of weeding fields

loans.name: Nissondiya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Nissondiya 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Daoulabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. And they know one another through ties of community, marriage, kinship, and their rainy-season farm work in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, beans, fonio [an ancient type of millet], and rice. 

With the goal of paying for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and labor to weed the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sirantou (the first women standing at the right in the photo) is a major leader of rainy-season farming in the village of Daoulabougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and tools in the village of Konodimini and also to pay young people to weed her field.

Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Madame   Fatoumata   (la 1ère  femme debout de la  gauche vers la  droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Fanzana. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de  Fanzana, de Ségou  et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari.
texts.en:
The six women of the Yeredeme 2 group are married into traditional families. They are, on average, 36 years old and have three children. They all live in Fanzana, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other from their farming during the rainy season and from neighborhood, marriage, and family ties in the village. 

The women in this group grow groundnuts, millet, beans, fonio, and rice. 

With the goal of buying some small equipment, seeds, and farm inputs and to pay the cost of weeding the fields, these group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fourth loan.

Fatoumata (the first woman standing on the left of the photo) is a leader in Fanzana of the farming in the rainy season. She hopes to use her loan to buy seeds, farm inputs, and small equipment in Fanzana. She will also pay some young people to weed her field.

Sales of her crops will be made in cash at the end of the rainy season. These earnings will be used to pay back her loan, take care of her children's small needs, and help her husband.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seeds, and farm inputs and to pay the cost of weeding the fields

loans.name: Sebitoli Chimpanzee Association Group

texts.en:
Switzer is a 68-year-old married Ugandan man with six children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. 

Improving his well-being has been the major motive for being involved in farming as a tea grower. He is requesting a loan so that he can rehabilitate his tea estate. Challenges faced include expensive chemicals and hiring labor for tea growing which drains him a lot.

He dreams of educating his children to higher levels of education. He is a member of Sebitoli Chimpanzee Association where each member guarantees the others.

loans.use: to rehabilitate his tea estate.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to help a member buy a sewing machine and iron

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 40-year-old man, married to Peris, who  adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with three children. Peter has been operating a hotel business for a period of six years earning himself an income of KES 5,000 every month.  

Peter is now servicing his third loan of KES 15,000 with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use this amount to buy more stock of consumable foods for preparing in his hotel to boost his business and improve the daily operations.  He anticipates to use the profits he gets to save towards the education of his children.  

Peter hopes to become a successful business man and buy his own land in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of consumable goods to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs e.g. seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Leila Marina

texts.es:
Leila Marina habita en el municipio de El Sauce, madre de dos hijos, tiene la edad de 45 años y desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de elaboración de dulces, oficio que heredó de su madre que hoy le da gracias a Dios por que le enseñó a trabajar y defenderse sola en la vida.
Doña Leila le ha tocado vivir una vida dura, llena de privaciones porque apenas llegó al tercer año de secundaria cuando le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria pero por escasos recursos le tocó empezar a trabajar a los 15 años.
Hoy se dedica a elaborar golosinas como arroz de leche, antefrijol, atolillo, mota de atol, todo lo que es derivado de la leche y de los frijoles.
Generalmente ella elabora estos dulces en la mañana para salir después del almuerzo a venderlos a las diferentes calles del municipio a pie, ya que las personas tienen la costumbre de comer un aperitivo después del almuerzo.
En este momento doña Leila tiene la necesidad de un crédito para la compra de zinc, ya que quiere terminar de cerrar el techo de su cocina. 
Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien este préstamo para cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Leila Marina lives in the city of El Sauce, and is the mother of two children.  She is 45 years old, and from a young age learned how to make candy, a way of living she received from her mother.  Today she gives thanks to God because her mother taught her to work and take care of herself in life. Doña Leila's lot in life has been full of privations because she only studied through the third year of high school when she would have liked to pursue a university degree.  Due to scant resources, she began to work at age 15.

Today she earns a living making treats such as rice pudding,  custards made of beans, fruit or rice, everything derived from milk and beans.  Usually she prepares these sweets in the morning and goes out on foot after lunch to sell them on various city streets,  since people often buy a treat after lunch.
At this time, Doña Leila needs a loan to buy metal sheeting, since she wants to complete the roof of her kitchen.  She asks the Kiva lenders to finance this loan through Ceprodel so she can carry out her purpose.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting

loans.name: Maria  Dominga

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene e de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se el presentan en su hogar, es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para seguir con la venta y así tener junto con su hijo una menor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 34 years old, has earned a living for several years by making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her place of residence.  She has many customers because of the courtesy she shows when selling.  From what she earns by sales she is able to pay cover the costs of her home.

Maria is a single mother and lives in her own home with her son.  She is asking for a loan to buy corn in bulk and lime to continue with her sales and thus have a better quality of life for herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk and lime

loans.name: 03 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hiệp operates a food stall selling shrimp. She has been involved in this business for three years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Hiệp is 27 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 03 Đông Hải solidarity group.

In 2013, Hiệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hiệp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is 34 years old. He is married to Christine, and together, they support people in their family. Christine provides additional income for the family.

Calvin sells cereals, a business he has done for the last 22 years, earning a monthly income of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has requested his fourth loan of 45,000 KES, which he will use to add stock of cereals for sale.

With the anticipated profits, Calvin will be able to pay rent as well as expand his current business even further. His hopes and dreams are to prosper in life.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals for sale

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es: Doña Reyna, tiene 64 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos, reside en un sector de Cofradía, municipio de San Pedro Sula, Cortes junto a una hija y nietos. Lleva 15 años de elaborar y vender comidas como pollo frito, tajadas, pastelitos rellenos de carne, tamales, tacos y golosinas como refrescos, churros, dulces, agua etc. El negocio lo tiene establecido en un puesto frente a unas canchas de futbol. Ha mantenido este negocio por la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente solicita otro por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar insumos como carnes, harina, condimentos, refrescos, churros, manteca, y otros para preparar los alimentos y surtir de golosinas para vender. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio y que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna is 64-years-old, she is a single mom and has 5 children. She lives, alongside one of her daughters and grandchildren, in the town of Cofradia, a municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes. She has spent 15 years preparing and selling meals such as fried chicken, fried plantain, meat cakes, tamales, tacos, and sweets such as sodas, churros (fried-dough pastry), candies, water etc. 

Her business is established in a stall in front of some soccer fields. She has kept this business with the investment of several loans. Presently, she is requesting another loan for 5000 HNL to purchase inputs such as meat, flour, condiments, sodas, churros, lard, and other stuff to prepare the meals, and an assortment of candies to sell. Her plan is to make her business grow and that her children can study.

loans.use: to purchase inputs like meats, flour, condiments, sodas, churros (fried-dough pastry), lard, and other stuff to prepare meals, and a variety of candies to sell.

loans.name: Gerifati

texts.en:
Gerifati is a 32-year-old married man with 5 children (16,14,12,9, and 3 years old), four of whom are attending different schools. He deals agricultural produce, with a particular focus on beans, maize, and coffee. He works 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, and has been in this produce business since 2000. The lower capital requirements, coupled with a desire to earn a living, are the reasons why Gerifati is in this business.
He is an agriculturalist who grows bananas, beans, and maize, from which he gains additional income to support his family. He hopes to use the loan to buy fertilizers and manure for his banana plantations. He normally sells his products to traders from the city and neighboring trading centers.
His hope and dream is to become the leading supplier of Matooke in the Rakai district. However, he faces a challenge of limited capital and poor weather conditions, which affect his output and profits, respectively.
He is described as an honest and hard working businessman, and asks lenders to keep up with the good services offered.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his banana plants.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a single lady of 55 years who supports only her grandchildren. She has been selling both new and old shoes to her customers and gets a monthly income of 18,000 KES.

She has applied for her second loan of 20,000 KES after paying her previous loans well. She will use the entire loan amount to increase her inventory of new shoes to sell.

She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of new shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to renovate his workplace and buy an air-conditioner

loans.name: Mango Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her mid-30s, is married with three children, including two sons and one daughter. All of her children are still in school. She has been running a poultry business for four years now. She works from 6:00am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salma's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy chicks and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She is happy with the loan and is doing fine. She will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feeds. She dreams of having layers in her poultry business as well.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group, "Mango", which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn 2 -Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Oanh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

Oanh is 51 years old and she is married with 3 children. Oanh is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 Thôn 2 -Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. In 2007, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Oanh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Oanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit Oanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Fenehasi

texts.en: Fenehasi is age 48 and married with six children. He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a civil servant who also practices cocoa farming to supplement his salary to meet his daily expenses, especially school fees for his children. His plans are to maintain his plantations of cocoa, finish his house and educate his children. However, he is challenged by small and delayed salary payments plus the unpredictable weather changes. Fenehasi will use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough cosmetics and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Manuela Ramos Group

texts.es: Marcelina de 60 años es casada y tiene 05 hijos independientes, ella es socia del grupo “Manuela Ramos” conformada por 06 integrantes dinámicas que han demostrado ser responsables. Marcelina se dedica a la venta de verduras y tubérculos en un mercado. El deseo de Marcelina es seguir creciendo en su negocio dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Su reciente crédito lo destinará para la compra de papa, zanahoria, camote y cebolla. El grupo “Manuela Ramos” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Marcelina se encuentra sentada es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste chompa floreado.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 60 years old, married, and has 5 independent children. She is a member of the “Manuela Ramos” group, made up of 6 dynamic members who have shown that they are responsible. Marcelina sells vegetables and tubers at a market. Marcelina wants to continue growing her business, to serve her customers better. Her recent loan will be used to buy potatoes, carrots, sweet potatoes, and onions. 

The “Manuela Ramos” group is grateful for this loan and promises to keep working well. Marcelina is seated in the photo. She is second from the left and is wearing a flower-print sweater.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, carrots, sweet potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Hamadah

texts.en:
Hamadah is a 27-year-old single man from Khan Younis. He lives with his mother in a small house. Hamadah works distributing goods to the local traders. He buys them from the wholesalers with low prices. He uses a rental rickshaw.

Hamadah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. By taking this loan, Hamadah will be able to improve his business and increase his income. 

Hamadah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 33-year-old, married mother of two children who has been working for one year at her house, selling homemade foods in order to help her family's way of living. She is a very hard worker and very optimistic about her future. 

Today, Sanaa is obtaining a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to ameliorate her business merchandise. In that way, she will able to serve her clients with good products. She expects an increase in her income and hopes that her business will grow and she will be able to reach her goals.

loans.use: to ameliorate her business merchandise.

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn Đông - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Đam operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell.

Đam is 55 years old and she is married with four children.

Đam is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Thôn Đông - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members.

In 2007, Đam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Đam faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Đam hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: 11 Tân Lộc - Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mai, a 47-year-old married mother of two children, has been raising poultry for more than 10 years, Illnesses are the main business hardship she faces. 

The leader of a four-member group, the 11 Tân Lộc - Hải Lộc solidarity group, Mai is requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

For the future, Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her enterprise to continue its success.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 12 Tân Lộc,hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Lý is 45 years old and married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 12 Tân Lộc,Hải Lộc solidarity group.

Lý operates a food stall selling fish, and she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. This is Lý's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, and she is requesting the loan to purchase more fish to resell. 

The main harship that Lý faces in her business is not being able to meet the high demands for products/services.

With her business profit, Lý hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 06, Thôn Lâm Hòa, Yên Mỹ Group

Cúc works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Cúc is the group leader of the Nhóm 06, Thôn Lâm Hòa, Yên Mỹ solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2011, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Cúc has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Cúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Cúc hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Tân Hưng Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Dung operates a food stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell

Dung is 28 years old and is married with two children..
Dung is the group leader of Nhóm 12 Tân Hưng Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2014, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Dung has been involved in this business for three years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Thôn 10 Quảng Lưu Group

Thông works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future
