loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn 06 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Quyền works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Quyền is 48 years old and is married with two children.
Quyền is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Thôn 06 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Quyền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Quyền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Quyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nurcihan

texts.en:
Nurcihan is married with three children. She runs a cleaning company. The company does general cleaning of both homes and corporate offices, as well as cleaning boats docked in the shipyards. She has employees working for her. Nurcihan says that she entered this business out of boredom, but also that she got into it because she loves cleaning. At the beginning, she would go out cleaning, even going with the employees and personally doing the cleaning herself. With the loan from Maya, she wants to finish paying off her purchase of a polishing machine. This machine will make the work easier, replacing manual labor. Nurcihan wants her business to be the number one company.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nurcihan Hanım evli ve üç çocuk annesi.  Yaşadığı şehirde temizlik şirketi işletiyor.  Ev temizliklerine gittiği gibi kurumsal firmalarında genel temizliğine gidiyor.  Bazı tersanelerde ki gemilerin genel temizliğini de alıp yapıyor.  Yanında elemen çalıştırıyor.  Bu işe can sıkıntısından girdiğini söylüyor.  Temizlik yapmayı çok sevdiğinden bu işe başlıyor.  İlk zamanlar kendisi de temizliğe gidiyor.  Hatta hala bile elemanları ile gittiğini ve bizzat temizlik yaptığını belirtiyor.  Aldığı kredinin üstünü tamamlayıp cila makinası alacak.  Bedengücü ile yapılan işini bu makinanın hafifleteceğini belirtti.  Yaşadığı bölgede aranan bir numara bir firma olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy a polishing machine

loans.name: Nhóm 54 Đông Hòa, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Thảo works in agriculture raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for three years. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Thảo is 23 years old and she is married with two children.

Thảo is the group leader of the Nhóm 54 Đông Hòa, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of eight members.

In 2013, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. In the future, Thảo hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Güloz

texts.en:
Güloz is thirty-six and the mother of two. To send her children to school, she makes and sells baked goods and hand-knitted items. At first she sold to her close friends and neighbors. She later got cards and flyers printed to reach more people. With this loan, she’ll buy wool and she makes hand-knitted items. Her goal is to open a store and expand her business, as well to provide a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Güloz Hanım, 36 yaşında ve iki çocuk annesi.  Çocuklarını okula gönderebilmek için evinde yaptığı hamur işlerini ve el örgülerini satarak geçimini sağlıyor.  İlk önce ürünlerini yakın çevresine satarak işine başladı. Sonrasında kartvizit ve el ilanları bastırarak diğer insanlara ulaştı.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile yün alacak ve el işleri yapacak. Amacı bir dükkan açarak işini büyütmek ve çocuklarına daha iyi bir gelecek sağlamak.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is 40 years old. She hails from Kenduawatikar village of Dumka district in Jharkhand. She is married with four children. 

The family has two shops; in one they sell homemade sweets, and in another shop they sell eggs. Her husband and elder son maintain the shops. Nirmala takes care of the household work and works in the shops when she is free. They have some cultivatable land, which is suitable only for mono cropping, so Nirmala’s husband grows only paddy.

Nirmala wants to expand her egg-selling business, for which she is requesting a loan of INR 6,000. She hopes to save enough for her younger son’s education and to repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to expand her egg-selling shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora  María  de 50 años de edad cuenta con  un negocio que la venta de refrescos y crianza de cerdos también cuenta con un trasporte de moto taxi donde presta el servicio a todas las persona de su comunidad, sus clientes la prefieren por la amabilidad con que los atiende.
Doña María  también la conocen por ser una persona luchadora y vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
Doña María esta solicitando el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cerdos y con las gancias espera mejorar mas su porqueriza y comprar más cerdos para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y apoyando de esta manera a su familia.
Uno de sus sueños es mejorar su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014
texts.en:
Sra. María is 50 years old and has a business of selling soft drinks and raising pigs. She also has a motorcycle taxi that is used to provide transportation services to everyone in her community. Her customers prefer to do business with her because of the friendliness that she extends to them.

Doña María is also known as a determined individual. She lives in a neighborhood in southern Honduras. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of pigs. With the earnings, she hopes to make more improvements to her pig farm and buy more pigs so that she can keep growing her business. This will help her to support her family. One of her dreams is to make improvements to her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2014

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Nhóm 04-Phố-3 Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Thanh operates a food business selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more food for making snacks to sell.

Thanh is 54 years old and is married with four children.
Thanh is the group leader of the Nhóm 04-phố-3 Quảng Thắng solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Thanh has been involved in this business for three years.
The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more food for making snacks to sell

The main hardship that Kết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Kết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more property for leasing houses.

Lan operates a food restaurant selling noodles, and she is applying for this loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is her lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

Hoa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Hoa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as salt, mushrooms, and beans to resell.

In the future, Lượng hopes that she maintains a successful business, her children find good jobs, and her family remains healthy and happy.

Miền works in agriculture raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for three years. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Miền is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Tây Hòa, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of five members.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Miền hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Lan is 24 years old, married, and has one child. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 04 thôn 4 Quảng Hải solidarity group. Lan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is married with five children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Alejandra is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer.

Alejandra has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she wants to have her own rice mill.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, cover labor costs and to buy better seeds to cultivate corn.

loans.name: Saraswathi Shg - Kodalikaruppur Group

texts.en:
Kokilam (hand raised in the picture) is a skilled and hardworking mother. She lives in Kodalikaruppur in Tamil Nadu as do the other five women who belong to Saraswathi Self-Help Group. Since Kokilam's husband’s income is unreliable, she has started agriculture to generate more income for the family. 

She is now using a mud stove for cooking in her kitchen. It emits lots of smoke and her kitchen walls have turned black and also it consumes a lot of time to cook.  

She and the other members are requesting a loan to buy smokeless stoves for their kitchens, which will save their time and promote healthy living.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos que tiene en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar ropa por mayor como pantalones, faldas, camisas, shorts, blusas, etc. y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The 25 year old client lives in her own home with her husband and son. She makes a living as a vendor selling clothing in the streets. She does this in the different neighborhoods close to her home. With what she obtains from her earnings and with her husband’s help they manage to cover the household costs.

The client is requesting a loan from Integral to buy clothes like pants, skirts, shirts, shorts, blouses, etc. wholesale and thus be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes like pants, skirts, shirts, shorts, blouses, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Nissondiya 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Nissondiya 4, sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Daoulabougou, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame Diominé (la 1ère  femme baissée de la droite vers la gauche  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Daoulabougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de Konodimini et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari pour le bien être de leur  famille.
texts.en:
The six women of the group Nissondiya 4 are all married in traditional families. The women average 38 years of age and four children each, all living in the village of Daoulabougou, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community, marriage, kinship, and their rainy-season farm work in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, beans, fonio [an ancient type of millet], and rice. 

With the goal of paying for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and labor to weed the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth farm loan cycle. 

Ms. Diominé (the first women hunched over at the right in the photo) is a major leader of rainy-season farming in the village of Daoulabougou. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and tools in the village of Konodimini and also to pay young people to weed her field. 

The sales of her produce are made in cash transactions at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan and finally to obtain the revenues to cover the sundry needs of her children; and part is for helping her husband for the well-being of their family.

loans.use: to pay for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and the labor for weeding fields

loans.name: Cármen

texts.es: Cármen es una persona de 65 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 5 hijos; 3 hombres y 2 mujeres, se dedica a cultivar maíz, de la venta de este grano obtiene sus ingresos, es un producto de mucha demanda ya que es la base de la alimentación de las familias, él aprovecha su terreno para este cultivo, su producto lo vende el mercado del municipio, Cármen necesita un crédito para por un monto de Q 1,000.00 para comprar fertilizante para el cultivo de maíz, con las ganancias que deje la venta de maíz  tiene planeado comprar ropa para su familia.
texts.en:
Cármen is a 65-year-old individual who lives in Sololá town, in the Sololá department. He has 5 children: 3 men and 2 women. He makes his living farming corn, and by selling this grain he obtains his income. This product is in high demand because it is the staple food for families. He uses his land for this crop, and his produce is sold at the city market. 

Cármen needs a loan of 1,000.00 quetzales to buy fertilizer for the corn crop. With the profits left from selling corn he plans to buy clothes for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for farming corn.

loans.name: Oyimgul

texts.ru: Ойимгул очень добрая женщина. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Ее муж занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Ойимгул тоже занимается собственным бизнесом. Она начала свой бизнес скотоводством 6 лет назад. Ойимгул откармливает коров. Она продает молоко и молочные продукты местным жителям. Многие ее соседи являются постоянными покупателями, и они очень довольны ее молочными продуктами. Ойимгул хорошо знает все тонкости своего дела.  Она хочет купить коровы и таким образом увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на суму 1400 долларов США для покупки коров. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Oyimgul is a very good woman. She is married and has one child. Her husband works with field crop cultivation. Oyimgul also has her own business. She started her business of livestock breeding six years ago. Oyimgul breeds cows. She sells the milk and dairy products to the local residents. Many of her neighbors are returning customers, and they are very satisfied with her dairy products. 

Oyimgul knows all the details of her business well. She would like to purchase cows and this way increase her working capital. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,400 US dollar to purchase cows. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy purchase cows to increase her working capital

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан молодой и жизнерадостный человек. Ему 23 года. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Хасан как многие другие жители его кишлака занимается скотоводством. Хасан начал свой бизнес 5 лет назад, так как его родители не имели денег, чтобы он поступил в университет. Итак, он начал свой бизнес скотоводством 5 лет назад и до сегодняшнего дня он развевает этот бизнес. Хасан обратился за займом в сумме 1000 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Hasan is a young and happy man. He is 23 years old, and married. His wife is a housewife. Hasan, like many other residents of his village, works with livestock breeding. Hasan started his business five years ago, as his parents didn't have money for him to go to university. So, he started his business of livestock breeding 5 years ago, and continues to develop it today. 

Hasan applied for a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollar to purchase livestock, in order to increase his working capital. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to increase his working capital

loans.name: Nhóm 03-Phố 3-Quảng Thắng Group

texts.en:
Hằng has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing to resell.

Hằng is 36 years old and is married with two children..
Hằng is the group leader of the Nhóm 03-Phố 3-Quảng Thắng solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Hằng has been involved in this business for five years.
The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Prabhabati

texts.en:
Prabhabati, a mother of one son, is from Maynaguri. She is 38 and lives with her husband and their only son in their own kachha house (made of wood, straw and mud). Their son is in college and doing his graduation in Arts. Prabhabati attended school until grade eight, but her husband has a secondary education.

Prabhabati's husband, 42-year-old Sukumar, is a car driver.  He has no fixed income. The money he earns hardly covers the daily expenses and the education of their son. Finding no other way, Prabhabati has decided to do something of her own to help her husband. She thought it over and decided to purchase a dairy cow and start a milk supply business, which is a lucrative business. There is a great demand for milk in her locality, so she hopes the business will be a profitable one.

In order to materialize her aim, she asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will start delivery of milk to her neighbors, who will be her main clients. The money she earns will be spent on her son's education and strengthen the family economy. She wants to improve her business to be able to save money for the higher education of her son.

She highly appreciates the financial help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Rojakuttam Shg - Puthupalayam Group

texts.en:
PAT (People’s Action for Transformation) manages the Self-Help Group, Rojakuttam-Puthupalayam, which contains twenty members in same locality in Tamil Nadu, India. PAT helps the members to improve the livelihood of the people. Thangamani is the leader of the group, and she lives in Puthupalayam village, Ariyalur district.

Thangamani is 35 years old and lives in her own house with her children and husband, Thuraisamy. He is a farmer. Thangamani has previously taken loans from PAT to improve her livelihood, and always repaid the loans on the time.

Thangamani and the other members are requesting the loan to buy a smokeless stove, which costs 1,400 rupees. It is better than the traditional mud stove. The traditional stove creates more smoke and soot. Smokeless stoves are affordable and comfortable for cooking and produce less carbon dioxide compared to the traditional stoves.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Puthuroja Shg - Kandayakollai Group

texts.en:
Usha is a member of the Puthuroja Self-Help Group, which was formed by a local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. She lives in Kandayakollai village in her own house with her three children and husband, Sagar. Usha’s husband is farmer and works on a daily wage. Usha has repaid all her loans on time.

Usha and the members of the group need a loan to purchase smokeless stoves manufactured by the Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt Ltd. The price of the smokeless stove is 1,400 INR. The traditional stoves are like killers in the kitchen, producing lots of smoke and causing health issues. The smokeless stove evacuates all smoke without decreasing thermal efficiency and without employing external power. It consumes less wood, leaves a smokeless room, saves time and labour, reduces carbon emissions and decreases respiratory disease of the residents.

They all hope this will improve their standard of living and they will have healthier families.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Cauvery Shg - Kandyakollai Group

texts.en:
Sasikala is 30 years old and living in Kandyakollai village. She is the leader of the Cauvery Self-Help Group, which was formed by the local NGO, People Action for Transformation (PAT) in Tamil Nadu, India. 

Sasikala lives in her own house with her child and her husband, Jayapal. Her husband is a small marginal farmer. Sasikala has been taking loans from PAT and has promptly repaid her loans.

Sasikala wants to purchase a smokeless stove, which is made by Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt, Ltd. The cost of smokeless stove is 1,400 INR. The smokeless stove is comfortable for cooking, high-efficiency, and designed for daily use. It produces less carbon dioxide, which is very harmful for children and pregnant women. Smokeless stoves produce 70% less smoke and are fuel efficient compared to traditional stoves.

Along with Sasikala, other members of Cauvery Self-Help Group are requesting a loan to purchase smokeless stoves for the betterment of their families.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Thenral Shg - Seelal Group

texts.en:
The Self-Help Group “Thenral” is managed by the local NGO, “PAT.” The group consists of 11 industrious women. They have been taking loans from PAT to develop their livelihoods for cultivation of paddies, sugar cane, ragi etc. They have repaid all the loans on time.

Chitra is living in Seelal is a hamlet in Tamil Nadu, with her husband, Arivalagan, who is a farmer by profession. They have three children who are studying in school. 

Chitra is the leader of “Thenral” group.
 
Chitra and the other 10 group member are seeking a loan to purchase smokeless stoves to use in their kitchens. They think this will be very convenient for them in cooking as it emits much less smoke and consumes less fuel. These stoves will help all the families have a healthier life.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati is a 30-year-old hardworking woman.  She lives in the small village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married and a housewife. Her family consists of her three children (two sons and one daughter) and her husband. All the children are students and read in grades 3, 7 and 8.   She and her husband Matin, age 42, are illiterate and can only sign their names. The poor financial resources of their family did not allow for their educational costs.

Saraswati's husband is a cycle-van puller. A cycle-van is a kind of transport that is widely used in rural areas in India, especially in West Bengal. He carries loads and people in his van, thus earning money to cover the expenses of his family's household. Very recently, the van was damaged in an accident.  As a result, his income has stopped and they are facing an acute financial crisis. They thought it over and decided to purchase a new cycle-van but lack the capital.

Saraswati heard that BJS gives financial assistance to rural women and she took a loan to purchase a new cycle-van for her husband.  This will allow her husband to carry on earning to strengthen their family's economy.

She wants to buy more cycle-vans to expand the business in order to provide a better education to her children as well as secure their future.

She and her husband give their hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Senbagapoo Shg Group

texts.en:
Thailammai (the lady who is sitting with her hand raised in the photo)is the featured borrrower. She is 53 years old. Her husband,Marimuthu is a farmer.They are living in their own house with their kid. 
Mohana, Ayina, Parvathi, and Mariya are other members of the group from rural Tamil Nadu. These women are the members of Senbagapoo Self-Help Group (SHG), which is managed by the local NGO “People’s Action for Transformation”. All the members have taken loans from this NGO to improve their livelihoods and repaid their installments successfully on time. They are all seeking a loan to buy smokeless stoves for their kitchen. Currently all of them are using firewood conventional stoves, which take a lot of time to cook and emit a lot of smoke, which is injurious to health. This loan will help their families lead a healthier life, especially their children.

loans.use: to buy smokeless stoves

loans.name: Saiideh

texts.en: Saiideh is a 44-year-old single woman who has been working in sewing, bead work and embroidery for eight years. She runs her business from home, because she lives alone and can proved her customers with suitable privacy. She is applying for her sixth loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to buy lingerie and start selling it as an additional business to increase her income and standard of living. She hopes to improve her business as much as she can to improve her living. Her previous loans helped her a lot in expanding her working domain, which reflected positively on her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and start selling it as an additional business to increase her income and standard of living

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a 25-year-old single young man from Jenin. His father is a worker where he gets a low income. Ibrahem is a student at a local university where he studies Business. He would like to take the B.A. degree and find a job in the future to help his family and improve their living conditions. 

Ibrahem took a USD loan from FATEN (Palestine for Credit & Development). This loan will help to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ibrahem will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily. 

Ibrahem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Najla

texts.en:
Najla is a 24 years old from Qabatiya, a small village near Jenin city. She is the mother of one son. Her husband is a construction worker; he gets a low income, barely covering all the family's needs. 

Najla opened a small store for selling beauty products. It is a good business and helps her husband with part of the family expenses. 

She  took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more beauty products for her store to resell. This will help her to improve her business and attract more clients. 

Najla appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products  for her store to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single man from Attel, near Tulkarm city. His father is an employee in the public sector with a very low wage. Ahmad works with his family on their agricultural land. They plant seasonal goods and resell them in the local market. Ahmad would like to improve the land and expand it in the future. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN (Palestine for Credit & Development). This loan will help him to build a new irrigation system for his agricultural land. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his land and increase its productivity. 

Ahmad appears in the photo on his land.

loans.use: to build a new irrigation system for his agricultural land.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 21 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mary Rose has been in this business for four years. In the future Mary Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and supplies.

loans.name: Kuldzhan

texts.ru: Кульждан 50 лет, замужем, 2 детей. Кульждан имеет высшее образование, работает заведующей лабораторией на заводе. Кульждан по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 35,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кульждан в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 10 овец и 4 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел, мерою 5,40 ГА на котором Кульждан выращивает картофель, эспарцет и зерновые культуры для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ее деятельность приносит около 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Кульждан дать хорошее образование своим детям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кульждан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Кульждан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, она хочет приобрести породистых доенных коров, а также, в будущем планирует купить квартиру.
texts.en:
Kuldzhan is 50 years old, married and has two children. Kuldzhan has higher education and works as head of the laboratory at a factory. Kuldzhan is by nature quiet, balanced and hard-working. Her husband and children help her with her business. As an additional income for her family, she has for many years worked with livestock breeding, after having started this business with 35,000 som (KGS). 

Thanks to Kuldzhan's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow, one bull-calf, 10 sheep and four horses. She also has a plot of land of 5.40 hectares, on which she grows potatoes, sainfoin and cereals for farm use and sales. Her business brings in around 25,000 som (KSG) per month, which is the basis for covering food and household expenses for her family. The income from the business enabled Kuldzhan to give her children a good education. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Kuldzhan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. Kuldzhan plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business. She would like to purchase purebred milking cows and also, in the future, plans to purchase an apartment.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more electric products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and electric scissors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy electric scissors and a generator.

loans.name: Naseem Ramadhan Group

texts.en:
Naseem Ramadhan is a group that consists of three women members who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Latifa is the leader of the group. She is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 19 years old and the youngest one is 3 years old. Latifa lives with her family in their own house. She studied only to elementary level and couldn't complete her study. Latifa's husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to meet all the family demands. Latifa wants to help her husband in purchasing food for the family because in the Holy month of Ramadan, food consuming increases greatly.

The Naseem Ramadhan group is requesting an 80,000 YER loan from AMB. Latifa will use her portion of the group loan to purchase food materials to meet the needs of her family. Latifa looks forward to opening a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her household

loans.name: Al- Saada  Al-Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
This group is called  Al-Saada  Al-Hodeidah and it consists of five  women who are all hard-working. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 100,000 YER. 

Hayat is 28 years old and a married woman with two children. She studied until the elementary level of education, but she couldn't complete her studies because she got married when she was very young. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family, but he became unable to look after the family.  Hayat decided to help him with that responsibility. She has been selling accessories, cosmetics, and makeup door to door for five years.

Now she wants to increase her business. For this reason, Hayat requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to resell to the women in her area.

Hayat expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through opening a small shop for selling all kinds of accessories and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories, makeup, and cosmetics to resell to the women in her area

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is a 39-year-old woman from the remote village of Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri. She is married and blessed with three children (two sons and one daughter) who are students in different grades in secondary school. She studied up to grade eight but could not study further due to her parent's lack of economic resources.

Jayanti's husband cultivates tea leaves. They have cultivable ancestral land where he works from dawn to dusk to earn for his family. Jalpaiguri is a district where the primary occupation of most of the common people is cultivation.  Since the climate here is favorable for tea cultivation, most of the villagers are engaged in cultivation of this crop. So Jayanti’s husband has to face too many competitors and he can't afford much capital to enhance his business. He earns so little that it is hardly sufficient to cover the basic needs of the family of five members that includes three students. So at present, they are facing financial crisis to make ends meet. They want to grow tea to overcome this financial hurdle.

Jayanti is requesting a loan to buy inputs such as tea saplings, manure and fertilizers to help her husband with tea cultivation. With this support, she will be able to fulfill her mission. Her dream is to grow more tea plants so that she will be able to generate more income for the wellbeing of her family and the future of her children. She wants her children get a better education in renowned schools.

She also wants to improve her crop a little every day so that she can increase the variety and quality of her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase saplings and manure to cultivate tea leaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  an embroidery machine and over sewing machine.

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a brave, strong, and committed young woman of only 20 years.  She is married and a housewife. Her husband Mithu, age 26, is engaged in a shoe repair business. They live in a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Purnima is a housewife.  Her husband is a cobbler who runs a shoe repair business at home to support the family. Purnima helps in her husband's work after doing her household jobs.  They have built a good relationship with their customers, who are mainly their neighbors. Purnima is an enterprising woman with hopes of getting ahead.  She wants to extend their existing business and offer better services to their customers in order to cope with the growing expenses of her family.

It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) who assists poor rural women with financial help to grow her business. She wants to use the loan to purchase leather, glue, thread and soles.  With these materials, she will be able to continue their business, meet the demands of their customers and make a very important infusion of capital into the business.  She wants to reinvest the money she will earn to improve their business, as well as pay for the household expenses.

She aspires to build their own shoe manufacturing business in the future and she gives her heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase materials for their existing shoe repair business.

loans.name: Ykua Vera Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas y cada una de ellas podrán conocer la situación en la que se encuentran y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando en cada aspecto de sus vidas.
Wilfrida es una mujer que se destaca, ella se dedica a vender comidas en todo el barrio, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día preparando las comidas que vende, ella esta luchando por poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar los insumos que necesita para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, que les será de mucha ayuda para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
This group is carrying out a survey on the elimination of poverty, where each and every one of them will be able to learn about the situation in which they find themselves and accordingly be able to improve in every aspect of their lives. 

Wilfrida is a woman who stands out. She sells meals throughout her neighborhood, she is a very hardworking person who works every day from the very early hours preparing the meals that she sells, and she is working hard to grow and to get on.

She is requesting this loan to buy the supplies she needs to keep making her meals, such as greens, meat, condiments, vegetables, and others, which will be of great help to her in her work.

loans.use: to buy greens, meat, condiments, vegetables, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stationary and gifts for his library store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing and Chinese products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase phone minutes cards and a variety of goods

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is married with two children. She is 58 years old and lives in Guipos.                         

Pacita is a farmer and grows palay and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers and chemicals.                                               

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Pacita hopes to harvest more palay and vegetable crops.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en: Asmahan was born in 1971. She is a married woman and the mother of two. Her husband is a retired man who is running a clothes store. Asmahan has been helping her husband covering their children needs by running their own mini market for three years. She is now seeking to purchase more food stuffs and new products for her mini market so that she will attract more customers and raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuffs and new products for her mini market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kadalpura Shg - Kathiramangalam Group

texts.en:
Kathiramangalam is a hamlet in Tamil Nadu. Mala, age 48, lives in this village with her husband who is a farmer by profession. They have two children. 

Mala is the featured borrower of Kadalpura Self Help Group, which includes eleven other women and is managed by the local NGO People's Action for Transformation (PAT). They have taken out loans from PAT previously to improve their livelihoods and always repaid on time. 

Currently, all members are using mud cookstoves. Smoke emitted from these stoves is a major health hazard as burning wood contains fine particulate matter, carbon monoxide, formaldehyde, sulfur dioxide and various irritant gases, such as nitrogen oxides, that can scar the lungs. Wood smoke also contains chemicals known or suspected to be carcinogens, such as polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) and dioxin, which can lead to fatal lung diseases, such as lung cancer, pneumonia, bronchitis, etc. 

Hence, all the members need a loan of 16,800 Indian rupees (INR) to purchase smokeless stoves to be used in their kitchens. These stoves are more convenient for cooking, hardly emit any smoke, and help save on fuel.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Rose Shg - Komakudi Group

texts.en:
People Action for Transformation (PAT) is a local NGO. PAT manages the Rose Self Help Group in Tamil Nadu, India, and helps them to improve their livelihood.

Rubiya is leader of this group, which consists of seven more members. Rubiya is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her family in Komakudi village. Her husband is a small/marginal farmer in their village.

Rubiya wants to buy a smokeless stove which is manufactured by the Greenway Grameen Infra Pvt Ltd and costs 1400 Indian rupees. Smokeless stoves are better than the traditional stoves as they emit less smoke and reduce the risk of having respiratory diseases. They are also durable and comfortable for cooking and designed for daily use. 

The other members of the group are also requesting a loan to buy smokeless stoves to have a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Bolodobolo  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Bolodobolo 1 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de  Banankoroniwere, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame Rokia (la 2ème  femme assise de la  gauche vers la  droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Banankoroniwere. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de Banankoroniwere, de Ségou  et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari.
texts.en:
The 10 women of Bolodobolo 1 Group are all married, [living] in traditional families. On average, they are 39 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Banankoroniwere in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women met through their farming activities during the rainy season, and through neighborhood, marriage, and family ties in the village. They grow ground nuts, millet, beans, fonio [a type of millet], and rice. With the goal of purchasing small equipment, seeds, farm inputs, and to pay the labor costs for hoeing the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their fifth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Rokia (the second woman seated in the photo, left to right) is a leader of rainy-season farming in the village of Banankoroniwere. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and small equipment in the village of Banankoroniwere, Ségou region, and also to pay the young people to hoe her field. Her agricultural products will be sold for cash at the end of the rainy season, [and will be used] to repay her loan and to have some income to see to the small needs of her children, [with] a portion to help her husband.

loans.use: To purchase small equipment, seeds, and farm inputs, and to pay the labor costs for hoeing the fields.

loans.name: Filena De La Cruz

texts.es: El sueño de Doña Filena siempre ha sido poder mantener su negocio, y que este pueda generarles los ingresos que le permitan apoyar en los gastos del hogar, al mismo tiempo que también desea poder ver crecer su negocio cada día más. Es por eso que solicita el crédito para poder seguir invirtiendo, esta vez comprará cosméticos y ropa de pacas, y que esto le permita mantener abastecido de productos su negocio ante la demanda que siempre presenta de parte de sus clientes. No tuvo ningún problema con el crédito anterior, el cual también fue utilizado para la inversión de su negocio.
texts.en: Filena's dream has always been to maintain her business, and for it to be able to generate the income that allows her to provide support for the household expenses. At the same time she also wants to see her business grow more every day. That is why she is asking for a loan in order to be able to continue investing. This time she will buy cosmetics and bundles of used clothing, and this will allow her to keep her business stocked with products in the face of the demand she always has from her customers. She did not have any problems with the previous loan, which was also used for investment in her business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hair products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase jewelry to resell

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS AMAUTAS PAN DE AZUCAR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención.
La socia tiene 03 hijos es soltera y tiene 60 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a  su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollos, saltados entre otros, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member belongs to the credit union, "Los Amautas Pan de Azucar." The bank is located in the Echarate district in the province of La Convención. She is 60 years old  and single with three children. She alternates her daily activities with a restaurant business. Her business is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. She makes various types of dishes such as rice with chicken, stir-frys, and more. She occasionally works in agriculture. She hopes to continue working this way to continue supporting her family. She has applied for a loan to buy supplies such as rice, oil, and more. She is thankful for the given loan and promises to make her established loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, oil and others.

loans.name: Simen

texts.en:
Simen, who is 27 years old, lives with her husband and one child in a community in the Bakan District of the Pursat Province in Cambodia. For the last seven years, Simen has been working as a farmer in a small rice field near her house. She earns as much as $3 per day from her farming operation.

Simen is borrowing a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. She hopes that this loan will help to improve her family's health and living conditions. Simen thanks lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than the general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Ancelita

texts.en:
Ancelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a nipa-roofing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa to sell.

Ancelita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Ancelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa to sell.

loans.name: Jaime Osmeri

texts.es:
Jaime, se encuentra acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos pequeños hijos, sus esfuerzos son enfocados en trabajar para cubrir las necesidades de su familia; se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol así como también a la crianza de ganado, estas actividades las aprendió dentro de su familia, cuanta con 17 años de experiencia, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m.
El capital que está solicitando lo utilizará para comprar ganado, con el fin de fortalecer su negocio, poder tener una mayor producción de lácteos, con los que mejorara la alimentación de su familia y el resto lo comercializara entre sus vecinos. Espera que sus ingresos mejoren
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio más competitivo, dar a su familia una vida más digna y apoyar a sus hijos a que culminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Jaime is in a relationship and lives with his life companion and their two small children. His work efforts are geared toward covering his family’s needs. He cultivates corn and beans, but he also raises cattle. Jaime learned these trades from his family. He has 17 years of experience and works from 6:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M.

The capital he is requesting will be used to buy cattle in order to strengthen his business and increase his dairy production. As a result, he can improve his family’s diet and sell the rest to his neighbors. He hopes to improve his earnings.

Jaime’s aspirations are to have a more competitive business, provide a better life for his family, and support his children so that they can earn a university degree.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Bolodobolo  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Bolodobolo 2 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de  Banankoroniwere, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame Djeneba (la 1èRe  femme assise de la  gauche vers la  droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Banankoroniwere. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de Banankoroniwere, de Ségou  et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari.
texts.en:
The 10 women of Bolodobolo 2 Group are all married, [living] in traditional families. On average, they are 39 years old and have four children. They all live in the village of Banankoroniwere, in the Ségou region (4th administrative region in the Republic of Mali).

These women know one another from their farming activities during the rainy season, and through neighborhood, marriage, and family ties in the village. They grow ground nuts, millet, beans, fonio [a type of millet], and rice. With the goal of purchasing small equipment, seeds, and farm inputs, and of paying the labor costs for hoeing the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their fifth crop loan cycle.

Mrs. Djeneba (the first woman seated in the photo, left to right) is a leader in rainy-season farming in the village of Banankoroniwere. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and small equipment in the village of Banankoroniwere, Ségou region, and also to pay the young people to hoe her field. She will sell her agricultural products for cash at the end of the rainy season, to repay her loan and to have some income to see to the small needs of her children, and a portion for helping her husband.

loans.use: To purchase small equipment, seeds, and farm inputs, and to pay the labor costs for hoeing the fields.

loans.name: Patron San Juan - Coya Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal PATRON SAN JUAN - COYA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Coya, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Zenayda tiene 41 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de madera, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de camas, armarios, mesas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de madera.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales menores, maestro constructor, restaurante, venta de motocicletas, agricultura.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the PATRON SAN JUAN – COYA Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Coya, belonging to Calca Province and Cusco Department.

The member, Zenayda, is 41 years old, married and has 3 children. The member’s business is selling wood: she makes different kinds of beds, dressers and tables, among other items. She has had her business for some time and it is going well due to the determination she brings to her work every day. She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting a loan to purchase wood. She is grateful for the loan provided and is committed to making her payments on time.

The other members have businesses that involve raising  small animals, being a master builder, running a restaurant, selling motorcycles and farming.

loans.use: to purchase wood.

loans.name: Luis Alex Edgardo

texts.es: Luis de 46 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, tiene mucha clientela fija, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra sacar a delante a su familia, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Luis está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, para poder continuar con sus cultivos y asi tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 45, has worked for several years in growing corn and beans. He sells his products in neighborhoods within the zone where he lives. He has many regular customers. This is how he makes a profit to continue moving his family forward. He lives in his own home with his family. 

He is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc and to improve the land shown in the photograph. This will enable him to continue his farming and to have a greater quality of life along with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Luz Margot

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION - RIOBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yanatile, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luz Margot tiene 37 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia  vende frutas todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia vende naranjas, plátanos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de naranjas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Riobamba [Virgin Immaculate Conception - Riobamba] communal bank. The bank is located in the Yanatile district in the province of Calca in Cusco department.

Luz Margo is 37 years old, has 1 son, and is in a common-law marriage. She alternates her daily activities working in agriculture. She sells fruit to all of her customers who ask her. She sells oranges and bananas, among others. She has had her business for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the dedication she puts into it every day. She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy oranges.

She feels grateful for the loan given and she promises to meet the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy oranges

loans.name: Maria Brigida

texts.es: María de 63 años de edad es una persona muy responsable y muy trabajadora que siempre se ha dedicado a trabajar para que a su familia no le falta nada, desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de hamacas, comercializa sus productos por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Maria vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de variedad de colores y tamaños de hamacas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y con eso ella podrá obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and is a very responsible and hardworking person who has always worked to make sure her family wants for nothing. She has been selling hammocks for several years, offering her products for sale in the different neighborhoods near where she lives.Maria lives in her own home with her family. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of colors and sizes of hammocks because that is her only source of work. With this she will be able to obtain a better income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of colors and sizes of hammocks

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOLA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre précédents . La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec FANTA la personne debout au milieu sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau de KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. FANTA espère réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Members of the Benkadi III group are married women who on average are 35 years old with three children, all living in polygamous families in N'Gola, part of the Kebila commune in the Kolondiéba circle, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and their past four loans have been fully repaid.

The featured crops are rice and groundnuts with Fanta, the person standing in the middle of the photo. With her ​​loan, she will buy inputs, seeds and pay for plowing to cultivate one hectare (about 2.5 acres). After harvest the crop is sold locally in Kebila to a clientele composed of men and women.

Fanta hopes to make profits of 105,000 CFA francs, enabling her to pay off her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy inputs, seeds and pay tilling costs for the crop year.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’TENA, un des villages de KELEYA, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  et le mil avec  MINATA, 1ere personne debout  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de KELEYA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 195.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi II Group are married women with an average age of 39 and an average of five children each. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in N'Tena, one of the villages found in Keleya in Sikasso Region, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their fifth farming loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

Minata, the woman standing to the far left of the photo, grows peanuts and millet. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain two hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Keleya to a customer base made up of resellers and consumers. She is planning on making a profit of 195,000 FCFA with each harvest, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, seeds and farming inputs

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 29 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa, él posee una panadería en el cual elabora pan francés, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues el pan está hecho con material de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además tiene el mejor servicio de la zona; Juan es un hombre muy activo siempre con la mejor disposición para dedicarse a su labor, Juan solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor. Juan tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá tener junto con su esposa  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 29 years old and lives with his wife in a relative's home. He has a bakery where he makes french bread. Lately, he has had many customers because the bread is made with high-quality materials and he sells it at a reasonable price. He also has the best service in the area. Juan is a very active man with a great ability to do his job. 

He is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy wholesale flour. Juan is confident that this way he will be able to achieve a greater quality of life with his wife.

loans.use: to buy wholesale flour.

loans.name: Prosperidad (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Prosperidad está conformado por 11 socias y 1 socio, quienes se dedican al comercio y a la realización de varias actividades las que les permite mejorar su situación económica, son personas amables, gentiles y  aun mantienen las costumbres de sus pueblos. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca que esta bañada por 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad,  tiene varios y hermosos lugares para visitar, la gastronomía de esta ciudad es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Catalina, tiene 23 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido una niña de 2 años, su esposo labora en la rama de la albañilería, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Catalina se dedica a la venta de frutas actividad que la desempeña desde que era casi una niña ya que su madre le inculco este trabajo, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también está estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad está en su tercer año de economía. El dinero de su crédito es para pagar sus estudios y comprar frutas para su negocio. Su meta es de terminan sus estudios y ser profesional.
texts.en:
The "Properidad" ["Prosperity"] credit group is made up of 11 female members and one male, who carry out various activities that enable them to improve their economic situations. They are kind, courteous people who still maintain the traditions of their people. They live in different areas of the city of Cuenca, which is bathed by four rivers and is a "Cultural Heritage of Man" site since December of 1999. There are varied and beautiful places to visit, and the gastronomy of this city is very diverse, captivating the palates of locals and foreigners alike.

One of the members of this group is Señora Catalina. She is 23 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has one two-year-old daughter. Her husband works in the construction field. They own the house they live in.

Catalina earns her living selling fruit, an activity she has carried out since she was practically a child, since her mother brought her into this work. She works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. She is also studying in a university of the city; she is in the third year of the economics program. The money from her loan is to pay for her education and to buy fruits for her business. Her goal is to finish her education and be a professional.

loans.use: to pay educational expenses and buy fruit

loans.name: Casiano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION - RIOBAMBA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Yanatile, provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Casiano tiene 40 años de edad tiene 03 hijos y es conviviente, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, el socio  vende frutas a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, el socio vende naranjas, plátanos entre otros, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Riobamba [Virgin Immaculate Conception - Riobamba] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Yanatile in the province of Calca in Cusco department.

Casiano is 40 years old, has 3 children, and is in a common-law marriage. He alternates his daily activities working in agriculture. He sells fruit to all of his customers who ask him. He sells oranges and bananas, among others. He has had this business for some time, and it is going well for him thanks to the dedication he puts into it every day. He wants to continue working in order to continue supporting his family in this way.

He is asking for the loan to buy seeds, among other items.

He feels grateful for the loan given and he promises to meet the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy seeds, among other items

loans.name: Assibi

texts.fr: Mariée, âgée de 38 ans, Assibi  est mère de trois enfants dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle fait le commerce  comme activité en achetant des plateaux d’œufs qu’elle revend à la devanture de son domicile. Assibi s’approvisionne trois fois  par mois dans une ferme d’Avéta, localité située à 35 kilomètre de Lomé.                                                      Assibi sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce de 30 plateaux d’œufs  afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Assibi is married and 38 years old.  She is the mother of three children and she lives in the neighborhood of Agoè.  She is involved in retail and she buys egg trays which she resells in front of her house.  She stocks up three times per month from a farm in Avéta, a locality about 35 kilometers away from Lomé.  Assibi is requesting a loan to expand her business and to buy 30 egg trays.  Her goal is to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 30 egg trays.

loans.name: Abakoranabushake Group

texts.en: Abakoranabushake means motivated in English. It is a group led by Beatrice. The group members sell different items in their businesses. Beatrice owns a retail business and has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more retail items such as rice, beans and lotion for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans and lotion for sale.

loans.name: Saem

texts.en:
Saem, 51, lives in a rural village of the Kandal province’s Oudong district. She is a married mother of six children, one of whom is still in school. Her family’s income is from farming rice. To gain more income, her husband also buys and sells cows in a local area. She has been in this business for 33 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about US$5 per day, and manages to save about US$3 per day for the future needs. 

Saem has just been with VisionFund for this loan cycle, and now she is asking for a loan to pay for her son's tuition fee at university, in the faculty of Business Management. She hopes that this loan will enable her to keep her son in school until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fee at university

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Ou Dong District

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: For the past five years, Juliet, who is thirty-three years old, has managed to persist in cocoa selling because it has helped her maintain her home affairs. She grows cocoa for sale though seasonality changes affect her, she wishes to have cocoa on a large scale and make more profits. She is so hard working and is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for selling

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El Sr. Tomas de muy joven viajo a la Argentina en busca de una mejor vida, trabajó como ayudante de albañil, luego fue tomando mas conocimientos sobre la profesión hasta llegar a ser oficial de obras. Con el fruto de su trabajo compro para su terreno en la ciudad de Carapegua  donde de apoquito iba construyendo para su casa, donde hoy vive.
Cuando regreso al pais empezó a realizar el trabajo de macate (venta ambulante) para darle una mejor vida  a su familia.   
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar todo tipo de insumos para seguir con su venta ambulante de prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás.
texts.en:
When Tomas was very young, he traveled to Argentina in search of a better life. He worked as a construction assistant and then acquired more knowledge about the profession until he became a skilled construction worker. With the fruit of his labor he bought a piece of land in the city of Carapegua, where little by little he built his house, where he lives today.

When he returned to Paraguay, he started to work as a street vendor in order to give his family a better life.

He is asking for the loan in order to be able to buy all kinds of supplies in order to continue selling garments, shoes, stationery supplies, and other items as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy garments, shoes, stationery items, and others

loans.name: Yupancca Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YUPANCCA, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Vilcabamba, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Hilaria tiene 49 años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, ganaderia, venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the YUPANCCA Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Vilcabamba, belonging to La Convención Province in Cusco Department.

The member, Hilaria, is 49 years old. She has a common-law husband and 4 children. She has a business selling food. She has had her business for some time and it is going well thanks to the determination she brings to her work every day. She makes different kinds of meals for her customers. She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

Hilaria is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients, such as cooking oil and rice, among other items. She is grateful for the loan provided and is committed to making her payments on time.

The other members of the communal bank farm, raise livestock and sell clothing.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, such as oil and rice among other items.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS AMAUTAS PAN DE AZUCAR, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención.
La socia Justina tiene 03 hijos es soltera y tiene 60 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a  su negocio, la socia cultiva frutas como naranja entre otros para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member belongs to the credit union, "Los Amautas Pan de Azucar." The bank is located in the Echarate district in the province of La Convención. Justina is 60 years old and single with three children. She alternates her daily activities with working in agriculture. Her business is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her business each day. She farms fruits such as oranges, etc. to sell them to customers that request them. She hopes to continue working this way to continue supporting her family. She has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She is thankful for the given loan and promises to make her established loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Divino Dios Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Divino Dios, meaning “Divine God,” is beginning its third loan cycle with Friendship Bridge. The group is located in a neighborhood of Quetzaltenango, the second largest city in Guatemala. It is composed of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors. The ladies have various small businesses including commercial sales (clothing, cookware, corn, and tortillas) as well as a convenience store.

Mariela is the Secretary of the Trust Bank and a member of the Board of Directors. She is married and has two children who are two and five years old respectively. Mariela has a textile business and sells clothing for men, women and children. She opened this business two years ago and has taught herself a great deal about what is attractive to her clientele. Mariela has decided to apply for another loan from Friendship Bridge to purchase wholesale clothing that she will resell. The business allows her to generate income and put some funds aside for the future of her children including meeting their educational needs.

In addition to obtaining a loan, Mariela and the ladies in the Divino Dios Trust Bank receive educational training during their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares useful information with all the women in their own language. Some of the topics covered include women's leadership and health, self-esteem, children’s education, as well as nutrition, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants. In addition, the ladies are more equipped to successfully manage their loans and businesses with information about effective business practices including accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing and pricing. Microcredit Plus is the name Friendship Bridge has given this unique combination of loans and education
