Mariela and her friends in the Trust Bank send their thanks to Kiva investors for their generosity in funding their loans. They look forward to a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing that she will re-sell.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Rory está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona muy alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona rural, que lucha por poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de las familias de cada una.
La Sra. Herculana es una de las integrantes, además es la presidenta del grupo, donde está llevando muy bien su trabajo, ella  tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de productos variados para el hogar. Es una persona muy luchadora que está dando todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante en el emprendimiento que está llevando a cabo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos varios para la venta, como comestibles, artículos de limpieza, golosinas, y demás de manera a poder seguir luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory group is in its 3rd cycle of the communal bank program and is from the city of Concepción, which is an area very far from the central area that is still growing. It is a rural area that fights in order to be able to improve the living conditions of the families of each one of them. 

Herculana is one of the members. She is also president of the group, where she has been doing a very good job. She has her small business selling a variety of products for the home. She is very much a fighter who is giving everything of herself in order to be able to grow and move ahead in the undertaking she is carrying out.

She is asking for this loan to buy various supplies to sell such as food, cleaning products, sweets, and others so she can continue fighting to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy food, cleaning products, sweets, and other items to sell

loans.name: Jessica Pamela

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad en la Universidad y le va muy bien puesto que es una chica muy inteligente. También desde hace más de 1 año trabaja como "ayudante de cocina" en una cevicheria, sin duda alguna es un modelo a seguir ya que siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace para poder brindar un mejor futuro a su familia.
Jessica está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá mejorar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes. De esta manera estará mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá luchando para cumplir una de sus mayores metas: "Convertirse en una excelente profesional".
texts.en:
Jessica is an enterprising young woman. She is 21 years old, single, and lives in Ica with her family.

She is a person who is very eager to succeed.  Currently she is studying accounting at the University and it is going very well since she is a very intelligent young woman. In addition, for more than a year she has been working as a kitchen assistant at a seafood restaurant. Without a doubt she is a role model because she always makes an effort in everything she does to provide a better future for her family.

Jessica is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the help they have provided she will be able to upgrade her dwelling with improvements such as plastering the walls. In this way she will be improving her family’s quality of life and she will continue struggling to meet one of her greatest goals: that of becoming an excellent professional.

loans.use: to improve her dwelling.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 54 years old and currently resides in Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She has been operating her own sari-sari (variety) store for more than four years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs. She works hard for she is determined to have a better income.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Felomina would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With an amount of 11,000 PHP, she can purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Felomina hopes to expand and open branches for her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials needed for the maintenance of the boat.

Sonia has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for boat maintenance

loans.name: Maria Camila Concepcion

texts.en:
Maria Camila Concepcion is 29 years old. She is married, and has one child in school. Maria Camila Concepcion works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested for a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar to sell.

Maria Camila Concepcion has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Maria Camila Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items such as canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and has two children.  She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. 

Ana requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ana would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tamosa

texts.en:
Tamosa is 53 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Tamosa has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Kyeshero Institut K Group

texts.fr: Le client Wingan est un commerçant depuis 14 ans, président et membre de la banque communautaire «Kyeshero Institut K», entrepreneur dynamique, âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 5 enfants, dont 2 étudient et 3 sont gosses. Il est vendeuse des petits poussins. Il étale sa marchandise à domicile dans l’avenue  d’intenses  mouvements de la ville. Sa conjointe est une coutière. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter  des aliments pour ces poussins (2 sacs de maïs, 1 sac de soja, des os etc.). Il commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, Il souhaite accroitre son capital, construire un grand poulailler, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs  non bancable.
texts.en:
This client, Wingan, has been a merchant for fourteen years. He is the president and a member of the commnunity bank “Kyeshero Institut K”. An energetic entrepreneur, he is 36 years old and a married father of five children, of whom two are students, and 3 are very young. He is a vendor of baby chickens. He displays his merchandise at home on a frenetic avenue in town.  His wife is a seamstress. 

He is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow his business. He is going to purchase some feed for his chicks (2 sacks of corn, a sack of soybeans, some bones, etc.). [She started her business with fund from her husband.] 

For the future, he wishes to grow his capital, build a house, and provide education and food for his children. He thanks Hekima for supporting unbanked women entrepreneurs

loans.use: to purchase feed for chicks (2 sacks of corn, a sack of soybeans, some bones, etc.)

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 54 years old and widowed with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marciana is borrowing 7,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marciana has been farming rice for 23 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Institut Kyeshero Group

texts.fr: Le client Munihire est un homme d’affaires et membre d’une plate forme «Institut Kyeshero», entrepreneur, âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants, dont 4 scolarisés et 2 autres sont encore gosses. Il est vendeur divers articles et sociétaire d’une quincaillerie et s’entraide avec son épouse. Il étale ses business dans un centre commercial de la ville. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter divers matériels de plomberie et construction (tuyaux, vannes, clous, câbles, tôles etc.). Il débuta avec de fonds reçu de son salaire quand, il fut enseignant. Dans l’avenir, il souhaite construire une maison, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux entrepreneurs gagnes petits exclus du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Munihire, a businessman, is a member of the group Institut Kyeshero. A 40-year-old entrepreneur, he is married with 6 children; 4 of them are educated but the other two are still too little to go to school. 

Munihire sells various items as part-owner of a hardware store. He and his wife help each other out. 

Munihire conducts his sales at a shopping center in the city. He is seeking a loan from Hekima to bolster his activity. He plans to buy various types of plumbing and construction supplies (pipes, valves, nails, cables, sheet metal, etc.). He started his business with his salary from when he was a teacher.

His goals for the future are to build a house, and to feed and educate his children. Munihire wishes to thank Hekima for supporting low-income entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking by granting them loans without collateral.

loans.use: to buy various types of plumbing and construction supplies (pipes, valves, nails, cables, sheet metal, etc.)

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo está en su segundo ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, son 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras que luchan por salir adelante, donde una de ellas es la Sra. Isabel.
Ella es la presidenta del grupo, tiene un Hotel a su cargo, el cual está administrando conjuntamente con su marido, tiene un hijo pequeño, son una familia trabajadora que día a día luchan por el bienestar y la mejor calidad de vida de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en mejorar su hotel, ya que así podrá dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, y luchar por dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The group is in its second loan cycle of the women committee program. They are 18 very hardworking women who are fighting to get ahead, one of which is Isabel. She is the president of the group, has a hotel in her care, which she is managing together with her husband. She has a small son. They are a hardworking family that day to day fight for the well-being and quality of life of their family. 

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in improving her hotel, so then she will be able to give a better service to her customers and fight to give her family what it needs.

loans.use: to improve a hotel in order to improve service

loans.name: Loeum

texts.en:
Loeum, 35, lives in a community of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has four children who are currently enrolled in school. To make a living, she works as a farmer in a small rice field which is located just behind her house. So far, it has been nearly 20 years since she has been involved in this farming business which can earn a net profit of 5 USD per day.

Loeum is an old customer of HKL as she has gotten seven cycle loans already. This time, she would like to get a Kiva loan to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Loeum thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 36, who is a mother of three children, lives in Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. In the last ten years, she has been in the farming business, growing rice and selling the products to local dealers and the customers in the market. This farming business allows her to make around USD 6 a day.

Tha wants to promote her convenient life by having a latrine for her family to use. Now, she is borrowing a loan from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to build a hygienic latrine for the sake for her family members. Tha would like to thank lenders for the financial support, via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Despertar  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Despertar está conformado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos, su  belleza natural y cultural hacen de esta ciudad encantadora, su variedad en la gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable y de un corazón cálido. Laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares,  aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. 
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María, es una socia amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Despertar, este grupo le gusta por la unión y porque los créditos le permiten mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar, por ello se encuentra agradecida con sus compañeras, ahora se encuentra en su tercer crédito.
La Señora. María tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y ha concebido una niña de 11 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña María trabaja de lunes a sábados en su negocio, ella prepara y vende comida, la preparación de sus productos lo realiza por la mañana y la venta por la noche. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio y así inyectar más capital y crecer. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The credit union, "Despertar," is comprised of eight women who live around the city of Cuenca. This city is bathed by four rivers and its natural and cultural beauty make tit a charming city. The variety of local cuisine attract the palates of locals and foreigners alike. The people are friendly and warm-hearted. They work in various professions that allow them to cover their living expenses while maintaining the culture and traditions of their towns. 

One of the group members is María. She is a friendly and gentle member who forms part of the credit union, "Despertar." She likes the group for its unity and because the loans allow her to improve the financial stability of her home. For this reason, she is thankful for her group members which are now in their third loan. Maria is 36 years old and a single mother of an 11-year-old girl who studies at a small, local school. She does not have her own home so she is renting. Maria works Monday through Saturday in her business. She prepares and sells food. The prepares her products in the morning and sells them in the evening. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries for her business, and thus reap more capital and grow. Her dream is to have her own house. 

The two small photos are of two members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Lyrma

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Lyrma has engaged in cooking and selling street foods in her community for almost three years now. She is 39 years of age and blessed with four children. Her husband, Raffy, helps her in their business and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Lyrma also cooks and sells burger and other snack recipes. She needed additional capital so she would like to avail a loan amounting to 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional raw products like pork and chicken and seasonings that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Lyrma dreams to open up branches for her business. She also hopes for her children to finish their studies and be able to find jobs fitted for them. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 49 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Expedita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items like shampoo, canned goods, detergent soap, noodles, and cooking oil to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, detergent soap, noodles, and cooking oil. 

In the future, Expedita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shampoo, canned goods, detergent soap, noodles, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 36 years old and has four children. She is a widow and has three children who are in school.

Cleofe and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,714 PHP to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Cleofe has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Cleofe can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 57 years old and works very hard to provide.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Arsenia has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis: Es un hombre luchador, casado, con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace 25 años vende de manera ambulante. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles: Reloj, carteras, discos y anteojos. Su sueño es tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is married. He is a determined man, he has been a street vendor for 25 years for the purpose of having his own source of income.

He requests a loan to buy merchandise in Managua and sell it at affordable prices: watches, handbags, CDs, and sunglasses. His dream is to have his own store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua and sell it at affordable prices: watches, handbags, CDs, and sunglasses.

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nazareth  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este comité están luchando por mejorar las condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, sale a vender productos de limpieza, por los alrededores de la zona de donde vive,  aparte de ello también tiene su almacén, donde todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de las capacitaciones ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, frutas, carne, bebidas, lácteos y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: The group, "Nazareth," is in its first cycle of programming with this committee of women. The group is from the city of Concepción, which is a somewhat distant area with limited access. For this reason, the members of this committee are struggling to improve their living conditions and that of their families. Maria is one of the members. She sells cleaning products in the surrounding area where she lives. In addition, she also has a grocery store where she works every day from the early hours of the day until very late. She hopes that as time passes and to the best of her ability, she can continue improving her living conditions. She is asking for this loan to invest it in the purchase of vegetables, fruits, meats, drinks, dairy products and more. This way she can continue selling as she has been. She is thankful for the opportunity and it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, drinks, dairy products, and more.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Being a farmer, Khom, who is 41-year-old married woman, can only make USD 5 per day to support her family. Khom is living with her husband and four children in a rural area of Battambang Province, Cambodia. Khom has been involving in the farming sector for nearly twenty years. 

Because it is hard to find a place for defecation, Khom would like to get a KIVA loan in order to build a hygienic latrine in her house. Khom is very happy with this loan since it will promote good health, environment and living standards in her house. She would like to thank for all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 52 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell Nipa roofing business in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of Nipa to sell.

Aida has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Nipa to sell.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 64 years old and married with two children.

Adelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Adelina has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear.

Adelina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Selmira

texts.es: Selmira: Es una mujer trabajadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 44 años de edad. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 20 años se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos. Solicita financiamiento para incrementar su inventario de productos del mar y con las ganancias percibidas comprar paca de ropa usada en Managua y venderla a precios accesible. Su sueño tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Selmira is a hardworking woman and a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 44 years old. With the goal of having her own source of income, she has sold shellfish for 20 years.

She requests funding to increase her inventory of seafood products. With the earnings she receives, she will buy a package of used clothing in Managua and sell it at affordable prices. Her dream is to have a thriving business.

loans.use: increase her inventory of seafood products.

loans.name: Maracaná Group

texts.es:
El comité Maracaná se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, son mujeres que se dedican a actividades eminentemente rural, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para que por medio de su esfuerzo vayan creciendo.
Graciela, una de ellas, se dedica a la venta de chipa, el cual es un alimento típico de Paraguay, ella sale a venderlo de forma ambulante, y por medio de este trabajo lucha para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar chipa para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por mejorar sus ingresos y estilo de vida.
texts.en: The group, Maracaná, was formed by the joining of several neighbors in the city of Santaní. They are women who predominately work in rural jobs where each is putting forth her best effort because through efforts they can grow. Graciela is one of them and she works in the business of selling "chipa" [round cheese filled buns] which is a typical food in Paraguay. She goes out on foot to sell them. Through this work, she is fighting to be able to grow and improve her living conditions and that of her family. She is asking for this loan to be able to buy "chipa" to sell. This way she can continue her job and fighting to improve her income and lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy chips to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiriton 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Tiessiriton 1, sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de   Banankoroniwere, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Kadia (la 1èRe  femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de   Banankoroniwere. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le village de Konodimini, de Ségou et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants, et une partie pour aider son mari.
texts.en:
The ten women of the group Tiessiriton 1 are all married in traditional families. The women average 39 years of age and four children each, all living in the village of Banankoroniwere, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community, marriage, kinship, and their rainy-season farm work in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, beans, fonio [an ancient type of millet], and rice. 

With the goal of paying for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and labor to weed the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle. 

Ms. Kadia (the first women sitting at the right in the photo) is a major leader of rainy-season farming in the village of Banankoroniwere. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and tools in the village of Konodimini de Ségou and also to pay young people to weed her field. 

The sales of her produce are made in cash transactions at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan and finally to obtain the revenues to cover the sundry needs of her children; and part is for helping out her husband.

loans.use: to pay for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and the labor for weeding fields

loans.name: Silvia Deysi

texts.es: Silvia de 33 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus 5 hijos de 16, 13, 11, 7 y 5 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella es una mujer tenaz que buscando la manera de ganarse la vida sin descuidar a sus hijos vende productos por catálogo de manera ambulante, además su compañero de vida aporta a la economía familiar gracias a su trabajo de prestar servicios de seguridad. Silvia desea construir una galera en su vivienda por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina, madera y clavos para la construcción de la galera.
texts.en:
Silvia is 33 years old and lives with her life partner and their 5 children. They are ages 16,13,11, and 7 and are currently in school. She is a tenacious woman who in order to make a living without neglecting her children, sells catalog products as a street vendor. Additionally, her life partner contributes to the family finances by providing security services work. 

Silvia wishes to build a shed at their home and thus is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy aluminum sheeting, wood, and nails for the construction of the shed.

loans.use: to buy: aluminium sheeting, wood, and nails in order to build a shed at her home

loans.name: Juana Alberta

texts.es:
La señora  Juana  de 36 años de edad es casada vive en sus casa de habitación  y se dedica desde hace 2  año a la venta de refrescos naturales y venta de charamuscas, agua, etc. también vende anafres y barriles, sus ventas  son  en su casa de habitación donde le visitan sus clientes que son amigos y vecinos de su comunidad.
Doña Juana también vende su producto de manera ambulante, vive en una comunidad de  San Lorenzo valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Juana está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de aguas, frutas, etc. Para poder seguir elaborando sus refrescos naturales y también quiere invertir en otro tipo de negocio en la compra de sandalias, braseares, blúmeres, etc. Porque quiere iniciar vendiendo esta línea de mercadería y así obtener más ganancias que le permitan  mejorar un poco sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es remodelar su casa y poder tener en un futuro una pulpería con mas productos.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2014.
texts.en:
Juana is 36 years old, is married, and lives in her own home. For the past two years, she has sold natural beverages, candy, and water. She also sells anafres (black bean and cheese dip) and barrels. She makes sales from her home where her customers, who are friends and neighbors, visit. She also sells her products on foot.

She lives in a community in the San Lorenzo valley in southern Honduras. Juana requests a loan to purchase water, fruit, etc. so that she can continue to make her natural refreshments. She would also like to invest in another type of business by purchasing sandals, bras, underwear, etc. She would like to begin to sell this type of merchandise so that she can earn more money, which will allow her to improve her income and quality of life.

Her dream is to remodel her home and offer more products at her store in the future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July, 2014

loans.use: to purchase water, fruit, sandals, bras, and underwear for her businesses.

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
As a farmer, Voeun, who is a 57-year-old married woman, can only make 4 USD per day to support her family. Voeun is living with her husband and seven children in a community in Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. Until now, Voeun has been involved in the farming sector for nearly thirty years.

Voeun would like to get a Kiva loan now in order to build a hygienic latrine in her house since she has never had one before. Voeun is very happy with this loan as it will promote good health, environment, and living standards in her house. She would like to thank all of the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Freddie Luz

texts.en:
Freddie Luz is aged 28, married to a farmer, and they're blessed with two children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village, and earns a net income of PHP 150 daily. Her net income on her business is usually spent on the school allowances of their children. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase biscuits, cooking oil, beverages, noodles, canned goods, and kitchen needs to sell in her empty store. She's hoping that her business will grow, improve, and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase biscuits, cooking oil, beverages, noodles, canned goods, and kitchen needs to sell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lorenza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Lorenza is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase additional material and gear for her fishing/fish vending business.

Lorenza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional material and gear for her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items.

Maribel has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Maribel aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, and other items

loans.name: Maxelina

texts.es: Maxelina: Es una mujer luchadora, tiene 42 años de edad, madre soltera de 5 hijos, en edad escolar cuenta con una experiencia de más de dos década de ser enfermera. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda, solicita financiamiento, para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos, postes y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda que le brinde las condiciones adecuadas a su familia y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maxelina is a determined woman. She is 42 years old and the single mother of five school-aged children. She has been a nurse for over two decades.

In order to improve her home, she requests a loan to purchase construction materials like wood, zinc, nails, and posts, and to pay labor costs.

Her dream is to have a home that provides adequate conditions for her family and to support her children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like wood, zinc, nails, and poles, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Almira works hard to support her family.

She has a direct-selling Avon and beauty products business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending and buying and selling dry goods. Almira is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy more products to sell to her customers for her direct selling Avon and beauty products business.

Almira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is married with four children. Lucila is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. Lucila is a farmer and grows palay (unhusked rice) and corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to to pay for 20 sacks of fertilizer and chemicals.                                        

Lucila has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Lucila hopes to finance agricultural products and be a buyer of corn and palay crops.

loans.use: to pay for 20 sacks of fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 32 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marissa has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marissa has taken a 9,714 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marissa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Margeline

texts.en:
Margeline is 44 years old and has four children. Margeline is married and has four children who are in school.

Margeline and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Margeline is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9485.70  to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Margeline has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Margeline can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Margena

texts.en:
Margena is 41 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Margena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs and feed for her business.

Margena has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feed for her business.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es: Hipolito: Es un señor trabajador, originario de Waspan, tiene 34 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, desde hace 3 años ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de tambo de madera. Solicita su segundo financiamiento, para construir poco a poco su vivienda y comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada y rustica, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una motocicleta y establecer un negocio.
texts.en: Hipolito is a hardworking man from Waspam. He is 34 years old and married with two school-age children. Three years ago, he began constructing his home from barrel wood with this goal of living in a secure and respectable manner. He is requesting financial assistance to build his home little by little and to buy construction materials including finished and unfinished wood, nails, and labor costs. His dream is to have a motorcycle and establish a business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials including finished and unfinished wood, nails and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Milrose

texts.en:
Milrose is 36 years old and has four children. Milrose is married and has two children who are in school.

Milrose and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Milrose is taking out a housing loan amounting to 9,557 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Milrose has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Milrose can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nilfa

texts.es:
La Srta. Nilfa tiene una peluquería desde varios años, esta afianzándose y formándose una clientela, ella trabaja todos los días y ofrece siempre un buen servicio a sus clientes, para que estos después hagan una propaganda de ella.
Gracias al buen servicio y la calidad de la atención, va creciendo cada día mas. Ella comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su peluquería, ya que por medio de ello podrá seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Quiere comprar shampoo, acondicionador, crema, tintura, guantes, maquillajes, etc., y así ofrecer buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nilfa has been running a hairdresser’s for many years, and she steadily catching on and getting some fixed customers. She works every day, always providing her customers with a good service to her customers, so that they can then advertise her activity.
Thanks to the good and quality care that she works with, her activity is growing every day more. She says she is requesting the loan to buy various products for her shop, as she needs them to keep on providing a good service to her customers. She wants to buy shampoo, conditioner, cream, hair dye, gloves and make-up, in order to offer a good service to her customers.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, conditioner, cream, hair dye, gloves and make-up.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase women's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn is married with 2 children. Alyn is 31 years old and lives in Segatic Diot,Clarin,Philippines.
Alyn sells variety of products in her general store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month she earns PHP 10000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14900 to restock her store with basic commodities.
Alyn has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future Alyn hope to save for future consumption.

loans.use: to restock store with basic commodities

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is married with 4 children. She is 55 years old and lives in Maribojoc, Tudela, Philippines. She is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

Lorna has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Lorna hopes to expand her corn plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa earns a living with her retailing business, selling products like grocery goods in their village. She earns better income from this and is able to sustain their daily needs . She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She had the photo taken while she's on the way to town to buy goods. In the future, Elisa wants to improve her business so as to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is married with 5 children. Avelina  is 74 years old and lives in Silongon Tudela, Philippines. She sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities. Avelina has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Avelina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Rosalie is 16 years old and is studying for a Bachelor of Hotel Restaurant Service Technology. She is currently in the 1st year of this 4-year course.

Rosalie needs 7000 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Rosalie plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 48 years old and with four children she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Priscilla has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Priscilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucy is 37 years old.

Lucy's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Lucy is taking out a PHP 9171.40 Housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Lucy has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. Aileen is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested for a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net.

Aileen has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Anunciacion is 54 years old and married with five children.

Anunciacion works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Anunciacion has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling school supplies, fruits, and vegetables.

Anunciacion aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Maa Baradevi Group

texts.en:
Lily, 35 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from Jagannath Vihar, Gopal Basti of Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. She is living with her husband and one son, aged 9. The member sitting first from the left with a raised hand is Lily.

Lily is running a dairy farm. She has two cows and gets eight liters of milk per day. She sells the milk in the hotel and earns her livelihood. Her husband gets fodder from the market and collects grass from uncultivated land. 

Lily, along with five other members of her locality, formed a group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses.  

Now she is very much confident in running her business and has developed her business significantly. At present, her monthly income is about Rs. 6,000. She wants to avail a further loan to purchase a milk cow and a huge amount of fodder to add to her business. She has long desired to have a dairy farm having five to seven cows and to expand her business.

The other five members of her group are Jharana, Maina, Santilata, Lily and Rama, who are running dairy farms individually.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and fodder.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for 5 years now..

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Cita

texts.en: Cita resides in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental with her family. She has raised pigs for nine years to make a living. She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan for additional capital intended to buy feeding supplies of swine fattening. She hopes to have an expansion of her business to generate more profit and be able to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies for swine fattening.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is married with 3 children. She is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. Conchita is a farmer, and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer. Conchita has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she wants to have her own delivery truck.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser.

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en:
Jenet has been operating their own farm to make a living. With four years in farming, her ability was improving and she gained better income from this, especially from her vegetable garden. Her husband works as an on-call laborer in their community.  

Finding ways to improve her plot becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. She took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.  She wants to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 28 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Joan works very hard to provide for them.

Joan's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Joan has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Joan has taken a PHP 9714.20 housing loan through NWTF. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild the family home.

Joan is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Steven is 17 years old and is 2nd of the four children in the family. 

Perlita, Steven's mother and a member of NWTF, is borrowing 6000 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Steven is currently in the 2nd year of this 4-year course, Bachelor of Science in Marine Engineering.

Steven plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen is 33 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Arleen has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Arleen requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 46 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested for a loan of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries..

Rosa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Rosa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a set of floor mats and other equipment to allow her and her students to perform in outdoor venues

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She earns additional income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Juliet requested a loan from NWTF for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional sacks of feeds.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Avelin has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

Avelin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. Carmelita is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Carmelita has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesus 2 está en su ciclo número 8  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. 
Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de bordados esta luchando para poder tener los medios necesarios para seguir dando a su familia lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones a las integrantes del grupo.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de 
materiales como aguja, hilos, aguja de croché y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y mas venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Divino Niño Jesus 2" (Divine Child Jesus 2) communal bank is in its 8th lending cycle with the women's committee program.  All of the members of the communal bank work and help each other to get ahead.  The are doing the Poverty Stoplight Program.  One of the members, Sra. Maria, was a "level one" in her last poverty survey.  
Through her hard and continual work selling embroidery, Sra. Maria is trying to have the means necessary to keep giving her family what they need to live a dignified life, free from hardship.  The communal bank advisers should also be recognized for their continual tracking of the group's training and member verifications. 
Sra. Maria is requesting this loan to purchase materials such as needles, thread, crochet needles and other items.  These items will help her to increase her production and sales, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, crochet needles and other items.

loans.name: Faida  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  FAIDA 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DONGORONA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil et le gombo avec  MAIMOUNA KOUMASSE, 1 ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "FAIDA 1” are married women, who average 41 years of age and six children each, all living in polygamous families in DONGORONA, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown are millet and okra peanuts, as is the case with Ms. MAIMOUNA KOUMASSE, who is the first person standing at the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers in OUELESSEBOUGOU. She plans on making an average profit of 55,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Djeneba's Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  FAIDA 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DONGORONA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide et le mil avec  DJENEBA, 1 ère personne debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau  de OUELESSEBOUGOU, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "FAIDA 2” are married women, who average 45 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in DONGORONA, a village in OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth farm loan with the institution. 

The crops grown are peantus and millet, as is the case with Ms. DJENEBA, who is the first person standing at the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of retailers and consumers in OUELESSEBOUGOU. She plans on making an average profit of 45,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, farm inputs, and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fruit to stock her business.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo nuevo, se llama Maria Auxiliadora, están en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están luchando por poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Pablina, quien se dedica a la costura, ya que es modista, ella comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le lleva muchos trabajos, ya que hace todo tipo de confecciones, es muy conocida en el barrio por el trabajo que hace, y por la calidad.
Pablina aprovecha este ciclo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, y de esa manera poder seguir con su trabajo, cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes, y luchando para poder mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
This is a new group called Maria Auxiliadora.  It is in its first cycle of the women’s committee program.  They are also taking the elimination of poverty survey in which all of them are struggling to be able to get ahead.

Pablina is one of the members.  She sews and is a dressmaker.  She says that she has very good clientele who always bring her a lot of jobs.  She does all types of sewing.  She is very well-known in her neighborhood for the work that she does and for the quality.

Pablina is taking advantage of this cycle to be able to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other items.  This way she will be able to continue with her work by completing her customer orders.  She will continue struggling to be able to improve more each day.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Tiessiriton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Tiessiriton 2, sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de   Banankoroniwere, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la République du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil, de haricot, de fonio et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, des semences, des intrants agricoles et de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Mamou (la 1ère  femme arrêtée de la  gauche vers la  droite  dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de   Banankoroniwere. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles, des petits équipements dans le marché du village de Konodimini  et payer aussi les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre en charge des petits besoins de ses enfants et aider son mari pour le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven women of the group Tiessiriton 2 are all married in traditional families. The women average 33 years of age and four children each, all living in the village of Banankoroniwere, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). And they know one another through ties of community, marriage, kinship, and their rainy-season farm work in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, beans, fonio [an ancient type of millet], and rice. 

With the goal of paying for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and labor to weed the fields, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan cycle. 

Ms. Mamou (the first women standing at the left in the photo) is a major leader of rainy-season farming in the village of Banankoroniwere. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds, farm inputs, and tools in the village market of Konodimini and also to pay young people to weed her field. 

The sales of her produce are made in cash transactions at the end of the rainy season to pay back her loan and to have the revenues for covering the sundry needs of her children and helping out her husband for the family’s well-being.

loans.use: to pay for tools, seeds, farm inputs, and the labor for weeding fields

loans.name: Roena

texts.en: Roena has been running a general store for many long years earning well to sustain their living. She had sustained the business and with her generated income, she was able to pay her previous loan used for the business successfully. Improving her business is easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently, she took  a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business, to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Marijane

texts.en: Marijane is 19 years old, single and a first year student taking up Bachelor of Science in Computer Science. She is a daughter of a vendor. She is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to pay for tuition fees and allowances at school. She wants to finish her education so that she will become successful in her career someday. She dreams of helping her family alleviate poverty.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and allowances

loans.name: Ely

texts.en: Ely is aged 32, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She managed a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Due to insufficient fund she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, salt, vinegar, soy sauce, and bread to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, salt, vinegar, soy sauce, and bread to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, is aged 22, married to a farmer and blessed with one child. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost three years, and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, beverages, detergent soap, and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coffee, noodles, cooking oil, beverages, detergent soap, and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 44 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Rebecca and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Rebecca is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9955 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rebecca has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her selling personal products.

With your help, Rebecca can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future She would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 31 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her agriculture business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Vilma requested a housing loan from NWTF for 9,321 PHP, which she will use to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and to pay for construction labor. Vilma is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He deals in the transport business using a pick up to make ends meet. He faces challenges of bad roads leading to constant mechanical break downs, which is an expense to him and competition from people with similar businesses. Besides that, he hopes of owning a bigger vehicle to expand his business and educate all his children to higher levels of education. 
Yusuf intends to use the loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Possiano

texts.en: Possiano used the previous loan to buy land. His business is very competitive and he faces challenges of high fuel prices accompanied by the bad roads whereby he has to spend his earnings on motorcycle repairs. He has a dream of buying a car for transportation and owning more than one motorcycle so as to have several sources of income. Possiano requests for a loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret used the previous loan to grow maize and beans. She is still in the same business of agriculture which has enabled her to look after her general well being. She faces challenges of limited capital and the unpredictable changes in weather. She has a vision of going for commercial farming in future. 
Margret needs a loan to plant Irish potatoes and harvest her maize.

loans.use: to plant Irish potatoes and harvest her maize.

loans.name: Ivania Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ivania  de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato general, se acompañó a los 23 años; pero esta relación que no dio resultado, ya que al poco tiempo se separó de su pareja, el fruto de la relación fue una  hija, que hoy en día tiene 7 años, va a la escuela y estudia su primer grado. Viven con su suegra la abuela de su hija.  

Ella es comerciante,  una mujer muy inteligente capaz de salir adelante con sus metas, se dedica al comercio de ropa, ya tiene más de 3 años de dedicarse al negocio, con sus cuñadas se dedicaban a la negocio de la ropa, luego ellas salieron del país y siguió su negocio sola, por lo que hoy lo tiene bastante fuerte. 

También cuida a su suegra quién es una persona de avanzada edad, la mercadería la tiene en su casa los ratos que le quedan libres sale a vender al marcado, o le llegan a buscar a la casa las que ya son clientes, la distancia que recorre es de un kilómetro cuando sale a vender, el recorrido lo hace a pie, no tiene un horario especifico de trabajo.
 
El préstamo es para pagar una deuda que adquirió con un prestamista, al tener una necesidad grande en la casa la hizo buscar una salida. Lo que sucede con el préstamo es que solo paga intereses por el capital.

La mejora que el crédito hará es el que pueda ir solventando poco a poco la deuda, por lo que se sentirá más tranquila.

Su deseo es criar a su hija por un buen camino, darle educación y que se pueda preparar en una carrera universitaria, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida, el préstamo le ayudara en satisfacer la necesidad pagar la totalidad del préstamo que adquirió y empezar a cancelar el nuevo de una manera diferente.
texts.en:
Ivania is 28 years old and studied up to her high school diploma. She married at 23 but the relationship did not have favorable results since a short time later they separated, leaving Ivania with a daughter. Today is her birthday; she is 7 years old and attends school in the first grade. They live with Ivania's mother-in-law, the grandmother of her daughter.

Ivania is a merchant, a very intelligent woman capable of advancing towards her goals. She sells clothes, having dedicated 3 years to the clothing business.  She worked with her sisters-in-law in the business until they left the country. She continued the business alone, and, today, it is quite strong.

In addition, Ivania cares for her mother-in-law who is very old. The store is located in her home and in her free moments, she ventures out to sell in the market, or she goes to her customer's homes. The distance she covers on these occasions is around one kilometer, which she walks on foot. Consequently, she has no fixed work schedule.
 
This loan is to pay off a debt Ivania acquired with a moneylender when a great necessity occurred at home and she had to find a solution. What occurred with the loan is that she has only been able to pay the interest on the capital. The improvement that the loan offers is that paying off the debt little by little, she will feel more tranquil.

Ivania's desire is to steer her daughter along a good road, giving her a proper education so that she can be prepared for a university career. For that Ivania hopes to continue working as long as God gives her good health and life. The loan will help to satisfy the necessity of paying the totality of the loan she acquired and begin to pay off the new one on a more favorable terms.

loans.use: to pay off a debt acquired with a moneylender.

loans.name: Maa Sindurabati Group

texts.en:
Gouri is the leader of a group that hails from Paik Nagar, Baramunda of Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 48 years of age. She has a small family comprising four members: her husband and two sons, aged 20 and 22. The member standing first on the left with a raised hand is Gouri. 

Gouri is managing an egg shop in her locality to maintain her family. Her husband was doing a seasonal business in her locality. Her husband helps her in getting eggs and chicken from the wholesaler for preparation of fast food like omelets, chicken pokada, etc. 

Gouri, along with five other members of her locality, formed a group to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to develop their existing businesses.

At present, her monthly income is Rs. 4,000 from her egg shop with a fast food centre, which is not sufficient to lead a better life. So, she wants to take a loan to add some extra items like eggs & chicken, etc. She has a cherished dream to have her own stall in her locality and educate her children in a better college to get employment in the government sector.

The other five members of her group are Basanti, Mali, Sajani, Supriya and Minati, who are doing book shop, tiffin hotel, gupchup, mushroom, and vegetable shop businesses respectively.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and chicken for a fast food stall.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en: Zakariya is a 28-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Zakariya, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Zakariya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, which is double the national average of 14. However, Zakariya is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Zakariya said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Michel and Markus, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a 28-year-old farmer from Kwankwani. As a Babban Gona member, Victoria is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Victoria can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, which is double the national average of 14. However, Victoria is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Victoria said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Victoria is on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: to access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Ashurbi

texts.ru:
Ашурби продавщица из города Кургантюбе. В возрасте 47 лет у нее имеются двое детей и муж. Три года назад при поддержке подруги она начала свой маленький торговый бизнес.
