Ашурби приобрела лавку на рынке и начала торговлю овощей. Эту деятельность она успешно продолжает и по сей день. Ашурби продает только свежие и качественные продукты, поэтому ее товар долго не держится. 
Сейчас Ашурби хочет увеличить товарооборот и с этой целью запрашивает кредит. За счет прибыли с продаж она хочет сделать долгожданный ремонт в доме. Поэтому этот кредит очень важен Ашурби.
texts.en: Ashurbi is a saleswoman in Qurgan-Tube. She is 47 years old and has two kids and a husband. Three years ago, thanks to support of her girlfriend, Ashurbi began her little business - she purchased a market stall and started selling vegetables. She is a pretty successful saleswoman, as she only sells fresh and quality produce, so her vegetables are always in demand. Currently, Ashurbi wants to increase goods turnover and is requesting a loan for this expansion. She plans to use the profits to finance a long-awaited renovation of her house. That is why this loan is very important to Ashurbi.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sinignesigui Group

texts.fr:
SINIGNESIGUI est un groupe de l’association NIETAGA de KANGARE. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’ustensiles à l’image de OUMOU qui est la seule personne assise sur la chaise de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE dans la commune de BAYA (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’encens. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. 
OUMOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à KANGARE, excelle dans la vente d’encens. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante d’encens. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à SELINGUE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et réinvestir e reste dans son activité ci-dessous.
texts.en:
SINIGNESIGUI is a group from the association “NIETAGA de KANGARE”. It is composed of women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. The women average 34 years of age. Married and with three children on average, they run different businesses, such as the buying and selling of utensils, just like OUMOU, who is the only person sitting in a chair in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in KANGARE, in Commune de BAYA (Région de Sikasso) Republic of Mali. The women have been working in small-scale commerce for several years and are much in demand in their incense trade. 

Concerned about satisfying the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program a year ago. They are on their third solidarity loan. 

OUMOU, who is the group’s president, is well-known in KANGARE, excels in selling incense. She intends to use her loan to purchase a significant amount of incense. She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit from a mixed customer base, she sells her products retail in SELINGUE. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest the rest in her work.

loans.use: to purchase incense

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en: Siraji is a 53-year-old, married man with 5 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in farming and rentals for extra income. He experiences a hardship of limited capital that poses him a difficulty in meeting his planned obligations. Siraji needs a loan to complete plastering of his residential house.

loans.use: to complete plastering of his residential house

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a hardworking man with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and also deals in a retail business. He faces challenges of weather changes like droughts alongside price fluctuations of retail products. As a focused parent, he hopes to see his children attain education up to the university level.

Charles needs a loan to improve his tea plantation by buying fertilizers.

loans.use: to improve his tea plantation by buying fertilizers

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 31-year-old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in retail and working as a surveyor, where he earns a monthly salary to supplement his income. He faces challenges of inadequate capital. However, he hopes of expanding his retail business to a wholesale shop. 
Albert needs a loan to buy ground nuts, soap, maize flour (posho),beans and sugar for for resale.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts, soap, maize flour (posho), beans, and sugar to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For renovations, purchasing equipment and assistance with the initial rent.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo is a 31-year-old hardworking man with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a farmer and retailer who faces challenges of limited capital and lack of enough land to deal in different crops and expand his farming project. As a loving father, he is determined to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. Deo needs a loan to plant onions.

loans.use: to plant onions.

loans.name: Cerma

texts.es: Cerma: Es originaria de Waspan, tiene 38 años de edad, casada con 4 hijos, en edad escolar. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, desde hace 3 años ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda concreto. Solicita su segundo financiamiento, para construir poco a poco su vivienda y comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento, hierro y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es establecer un negocio y apoyar en desarrollo profesional y humano de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cerma is originally from Waspan. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are of school age.

With the intent of living in a secure and decent manner, Cerma started the construction of her concrete house three years ago. She is requesting her second loan so that she can gradually build her home. Cerma will buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, and iron, as well as cover the cost of labor.

Her dreams include establishing a business and supporting the professional and personal development of her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Ibrahim, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  

“In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Ibrahim. With this loan, Ibrahim is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supplement her assortment of goods by buying picture frames, albums, barrettes and hair clips, artificial flowers, balloons and greeting cards.

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas Group

texts.es:
“Mujeres Poderosas” está en su 3º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, ya que a través de él podrán conocer la situación de cada una de ellas y conforme a ello poder trabajar y estudiar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Isabel, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que significa que debe seguir con su esfuerzo y de esa forma poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y con el préstamo que pide quiere comprar productos en mayor cantidad para abaratar los costos, como ser panes, verduras, condimentos, hamburguesas y demás. Es una señora muy trabajadora y solidaria  que se destaca por su trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Poderosas” (Powerful Women) is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have taken the poverty elimination survey, which allows them to become familiar with each of their situations and helps them to work and study accordingly.

One of the members is Sra. Isabel, whose survey indicated that she was at a Stage 1 poverty level. This means that she should continue her efforts to provide her family with everything that she was not able to have. The work that she pursues involves selling hamburgers, so the loan she is requesting will be used to buy products in large quantities in order to reduce her costs. These items include bread, vegetables, condiments, hamburger meat, and other items. Isabel is a hardworking and caring woman who is known for her work and effort.

loans.use: to buy bread, vegetables, condiments, hamburger meat, and other items.

loans.name: Santa Rosa Poty Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Santa Rosa Poty, está integrado por un gran número de Señoras, de la ciudad de San Pedro, una ciudad bastante alejada de la zona de la capital, y que se encuentra en crecimiento. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener.
La señora Justina, una de ellas,  trabaja como macatera (vendedora ambulante), trae ltodo tipo de productos que vende como ropas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás. Ella es una persona que se está esforzando por poder salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener.
Justina pide este préstamo para poder comprar  abrigos, pantalones, frazadas, bufandas, guantes, manteles, artículos de Bijouteries, etc., para poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
The group Santa Rosa Poty is composed of a large number of women from the town of San Pedro, a remote area of the capital that is currently expanding. The women are the heads of their households who want to give their families what they themselves could not have. 

Mrs. Justina works as macatera (street vendor), selling all types of products such as clothes, shoes, stationery items, etc. She is a person who is striving to get ahead and give her family everything she could not have. 

Mrs. Justina is requesting this loan to buy coats, pants, blankets, scarves, gloves, tablecloths, costume jewelry, etc., to continue with her sales and improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy coats, pants, blankets, scarves, gloves, tablecloths, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony has been growing pigs to sell in town and has had this business for many years. This is one of the primary source of income for the family. His wife is also running a general store and it adds income for the family. Anthony took a new loan recently to buy feeds for swine fattening as well as provide additional capital for a sari sari store. He joined GDMPC this current year and he gains access to micro-finance services of the cooperative. Anthony is planning to expand his piggery, hoping it will flourish and enable him to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds for swine fattening as well as to provide additional capital for sari sari store

loans.name: Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es:
El comité Inmaculada Concepción se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades eminentemente rurales, ya que son de una zona bastante alejada de la capital y que aun está en crecimiento, están recibiendo constantes capacitaciones para poder ir mejorando.
En el caso de la Sra. Benigna quien únicamente se dedicaba a la plantación y venta de mandioca con este préstamo que pide quiere comprar algunos animales y tenerlos como una actividad secundaria y de esa forma poder incrementar un poco más sus ventas y condiciones de vida y la de su familia
texts.en:
The Immaculate Conception (Inmaculada Concepción) Committee was formed by the joining together of several neighbors from the city of Santaní. All committee members make a living doing predominantly rural activities, as they are fairly isolated from the capital and the area is still growing. They are receiving ongoing training in order to continue improving. 

In the case of Benigna, she was solely involved in the planting and sale of cassava. With this loan she is asking for,  she wants to buy some animals and have them as a secondary activity and thus slightly increase sales and improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for breeding and for sale.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him in managing their farm. In order to purchase fertilizer, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC, which she had joined recently. Improving their lives becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. She hopes to gain more harvest in order to send her children to school and to be able to provide the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 37-year-old hardworking man with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in agriculture and working as a bursar, where he earns extra income. He faces challenges such a changes in weather conditions that highly affects his agricultural business. He has a vision of dealing in commercial agriculture, whereby he is assured of market for his products. Patrick will use the loan to rent a banana (kisubi) plantation to make local brew to sell.

loans.use: to rent a banana (kisubi) plantation to make local brew to sell.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: El comité se llama La Amistad, es un grupo muy unido y bastante numeroso cuenta con 24 integrantes, han pasado al 4to ciclo y están muy confiadas que la ayuda que les brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva será de mucha utilidad para el progreso de los mismos. Estas mujeres son dignas de orgullo por su labor diaria para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de los suyos, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Jovina que antes se dedicaba solo a la venta de chipa, un alimento típico paraguayo, y hoy pide este préstamo para poder montar su chipería independiente. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The committee La Amistad [Friendship] is a very close, fairly large group of 24 members. They are on their fourth loan and very confident that the assistance brought by Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva will be very useful to their progress.

These women deserve to be proud of their day-to-day work to improve their quality of life and that of their family.  Prominent among them is Jovina, who was previously just selling chipas [cheese rolls], a typical Paraguayan food, and who is today requesting this loan to be able to start her own independent chipería. She is thankful for the opportunity offered to her which will be of great help.

loans.use: to start an independent chipería [cheese roll business].

loans.name: Alyona

texts.ru:
Алена занимается торговлей продуктами питания как частный предприниматель в арендованном помещении в с. Дружне. Ее магазинчик расположен недалеко от красивого озера. Этим бизнесом Алена занимается немного больше 9 месяцев. Торгует в основном разными сладостями. У Алены были определенные трудности с торговлей после нового года, стало меньше клиентов в связи с событиями в стране и на Востоке. Однако в последнее время торговля пошла на улучшение. 
Алена планирует вложить 4 000 гривен в улучшение условий проживания своей семьи.  Она хочет поменять старые входные двери на новые бронированные, и со временем сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Alyona sells groceries from a rented store space in Druzhnye village. Her grocery store is located next to a beautiful lake. Alyona had her store for only 9 months and mostly sells various candy and sweets. After the new year Alyona was faced with problems - fewer clients due to the unstable situation in the Eastern Ukraine. But now the sales have began to improve again. Alyona plans to use the loan of 40,000 griven to improve her family's living conditions. She wants to replace the old front door and install a new armored one and also renovate her home.

loans.use: to change the old entrance door and install a new armored door

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Maliha's  group's $ 3,000  loan helps a member to buy a new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Zaryl

texts.ru: Зарыл 55 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Зарыл среднее образование. Зарыл по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Зарыл в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 3 кобылы, а также имеет земельный надел мерою 2,00 ГА, на котором она  выращивает ячмень и сено. Ее деятельность приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, молочной продукции, мяса и перепродажи скота. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зарыл обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Зарыл планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет женить сына.
texts.en: Zaryl is 55 years old, married and has three children. She has a high school degree. Zaryl is a calm, steady and hardworking woman. Her husband and her children help her in her business, which was started with 5,000 som (KGS) many years ago. Farming and livestock is the main source of income for the family and they own two milk cows, three calves, three mares as well as 2 hectares of land where they grow oats and hey. Zaryl's farm brings in 5,000 som (KGS) a month, mainly from dairy, meat and animal sales. In order to further expand the herd, Zaryl has turned to "Bai-Tushum" bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS). She will use the loan to buy sheep and invest the profits back into the farm. In the future Zaryl hopes to save enough for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase sheeps

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Emprendedoras se llama este grupo, es nuevo está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comité además de ello están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder trabajar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Anicia quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe esforzarse un poco un más, lo cual hace por medio de su venta de frutas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Anicia pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas frescas, para que por medio de ello pueda seguir con sus ventas, ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Women Entrepreneurs  (Las Emprendedoras) is the name of this new group. They are in their first program cycle. In addition to this, they are doing a poverty elimination survey, which will allow them to get to know the situation of each one and accordingly work to improve their living conditions. 

One of the members is Anicia. In the latest survey, she showed a "level one" poverty level, which means she needs to work a little harder, which she does by selling fruit. 

Additionally, the work of the consultants stands out, as they continually monitor training and check-ups, which are demanding but, at the same time,  encourage the women to fight to overcome poverty. 

Anicia is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of fresh fruits. With this, she will be able to continue selling and offering a wide variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Marieve

texts.en: Marieve, 30 years old, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost two years and earns a net income of 800 PHP daily. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 11,000 PHP to purchase sugar, coffee, biscuits, detergent soaps, noodles, and canned goods to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, biscuits, detergent soaps, noodles, and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 59 años de edad y vive en Ucayali junto a su familia.
Es muy trabajadora, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en la agricultura, el principal producto que cultiva es la yuca debido a las condiciones favorables de la zona para dicho cultivo. Le va muy bien ya que tiene un amplio conocimiento sobre esto y siempre se esfuerza  en brindar productos de calidad a un precio que se ajusta a las necesidades del cliente. Es sin duda alguna una mujer ejemplar ya que trabaja incansablemente para poder sacar a su familia adelante.
Juana está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá ampliar sus plantaciones de yuca e innovar con el cultivo de maíz. Con esto ella obtendrá mayores ganancias y seguirá esforzándose para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is an entrepreneurial woman. She is 59 years old and lives in Ucayali, along with her family. Juana is a hardworking woman with more than 20 years of experience in agriculture. The primary crop she grows is yuca because of the favorable conditions this region has for this crop. Things have gone well for Juana and she is very knowledgeable about her trade. She works hard to offer good quality products at prices that she adjusts to the needs of her customers. 

Juana is, without a doubt, an exemplary woman who works tirelessly to help her family get ahead. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this support offered to her will allow her to widen her yuca fields and innovate her work by sowing corn. With this, she will obtain higher profits and continue to work hard to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to widen her fields of yuca and to sow more corn.

loans.name: Ireti

texts.en: Ireti is a 57-year-old, hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a farmer who grows crops for both home consumption and selling. She complains of hardships of limited capital coupled with unpredictable weather changes, especially prolonged drought. Despite these challenges, she hopes to construct a good residential house as her future plan. Ireti needs a loan to harvest maize for selling.

loans.use: to harvest maize for selling

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en: Adelita has been working on her farm for a living. For more than four years, she was able to sustain it and she successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. With her revenue, she put up a snack and fish vending business, and she earns daily from this. To prepare more volumes of snacks and to sell more fish, she took a new loan for additional capital for snack and fish vending. Adelita always wants to have a better life with her family in the future.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for snacks and fish vending

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Janeth works hard to support her family.

She has a jewelries business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Janeth is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy raw materials and shells for her jewelries for her jewelries business.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and shells for her jewelries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, cement boards, iron, and cinder block

loans.name: Transito Romeo

texts.es:
Transito es un hombre de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, sus condiciones económicas no le permitieron estudiar más. Es soltero ya que se separó con su esposa, tiene un hijo mayor de edad. Transito vive con su madre y una hermana. Solo su hijo es quien depende de él.

Transito se dedica a trabajar como agricultor sembrando granos básicos  como maíz, maicillo, y cuando no hay trabajo en los cultivos, trabaja de ayudante en un bus. 

Desde que tenía aproximadamente 14 años aprendió esta actividad, porque sus padres era lo única que tenían también. Él iba a veces a dejar los alimentos a su padre al lugar donde trabajaba y se quedaba a ayudarle fue así como aprendió a ganarse el sustento diario para él  y su familia,  siempre ha sido jornalero, el lugar donde trabaja le queda a unos 20 minutos aproximadamente y se transporta a pie, cuando trabaja en el bus entra a las 7:00 am. y sale a las 4:30 p.m.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, para la milpa de postrera y otra parte para la siembra de frijol. También pagara mano de obra que le ayuden a realizar las actividades agrícolas. Con el financiamiento tendrá la oportunidad de comprar lo que necesita para mejor su producción, ya que a veces se ha visto limitado económicamente y no ha podido hacer todo lo que ha pensado trabajar.


     El sueño de  Transito es mejorar sus producciones mediante el crédito, seguir trabajando con credicampo y lograr sus sueños, también quiere mejorar la condición de su vivienda, ya que hay partes que están dañadas y corre peligro de cualquier accidente.
texts.en:
Transito is a 45-year-old man. He studied up until the 7th grade, but his financial circumstances did not allow him to study longer. Transito is single now that he separated from his wife. He has one adult son who is still dependent on him. Transito lives with his mother and sister.

Transito makes a living as a farmer, growing basic crops such as corn and sorghum. When he does not need to work on these, Transito works as a bus attendant.  

Since he was about 14 years old, he learned this trade because this was all his parents had as well. Transito used to drop off food for his father where he worked and then he would stay behind and help him. In this way, he learned to earn a living and provide for his family. Transito has always worked as a day laborer in a place located about a 20-minute walk away. When he works on the bus he starts at 7 a.m. and finishes at 4:30 p.m. 

The loan that Transito is requesting will allow him to buy fertilizer, weed killer, and pesticides for his back fields as well as to pay laborers for help working the fields. With his loan, he will have the opportunity to buy what he needs to improve his production. At times he has been limited financially and has not been able to do all the work that he had planned.

Transito's dream is to improve his production through this loan, continue working with Credicampo, and achieve his goals. He also wants to improve the condition of his home since there are damaged parts that run the risk of causing an accident.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed killer, and pesticides for the back fields as well as to sow beans. He will also be able to pay laborers to help him with the work in his fields.

loans.name: Galicia

texts.es:
La señora Galicia es cliente antigua de la fundación, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se esfuerza por poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas variadas que ella misma sale a vender a sus clientes fijos que tiene. Comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, y que siempre tiene muy buenos pedidos.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de joyas variadas, para que de esta forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le será de mucha ayuda, no solo para ella, sino también para su familia.
texts.en: Galicia is a long-time customer of the Paraguayan Foundation (Fundación Paraguaya). She is a hard-working, entrepreneurial woman. She works hard to be able to give her family everything that she wasn't able to have. She makes a living selling assorted jewelry that she sells to her regular customers. She says that she has great clientele and that she always has great orders. She is asking for this loan in order to buy assorted jewelry, so that she can continue selling, just like she's been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given. She says that it will be of much help, not only for her, but also for her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Being a farmer, Thou, who is a 42-year-old, married woman, can only make USD 3 per day to support her family. Thou is living with her husband and five children in a rural area of Pursat Province, Cambodia. So far, Thou has been involved in the farming sector for nearly 20 years.

Because it is hard to find a place to relieve herself, Thou would like to get a Kiva loan now in order to build a hygienic latrine in her house. Thou is very happy with this loan since it will promote good health, environment, and living standards in her house. She would like to thank all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan to poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Joan is 31 years old and all of her children are in school.

She has a jewelry business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials and other supplies for her jewelry.

Joan has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials and other supplies for her jewelry.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support of the previous loan as she was able to expand her business and increase her monthly profits.

Beatrice comes to you requesting another loan of KES 20,000 to buy cotton khangas (women's wrap clothing) for sale. They are very costly. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cotton khangas (women's wrap clothing) for sale

loans.name: Adal

texts.en:
Here’s Adal. He lives with his brother in a remote location in one of the 808 non-electrified Oaxaca villages (Mexico), so they did not have electric light at home before the installation of the Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that includes 3 lamps which provide daily 4 hours of light each for reading for instance and gives the possibility of connecting a radio to be informed.

Funding is asked for financing the 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Bensie

texts.en:
Bensie runs a general store, selling various goods in the local community. She has been doing this for more than eight years and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods. 

To offer more goods in her store, she took recently her new loan to buy more grocery goods to sell. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 57 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a household goods vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marciana has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.en:
Jose Antonio is a Mexican farmer who lives alone in a remote community of the State of Oaxaca. In the picture, he was just gathering the equipment of his new Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, which he could install by his own in his house after. The SSHS gives him more hours of light to be awake and the chance to connect a radio that may mitigate his isolation.
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly works hard to support her family. Nelly is a widow and has a buy and sell household goods business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell. Nelly has been in this business for 35 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is a 24-year-old farmer who lives alone in a remote community in the Mexican State of Oaxaca. He did not have light at home before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that includes 3 lamps which provide daily 4 hours of light each for reading for instance and the possibility of connecting a radio, mitigating his isolation. 
Funding is asked for financing the 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this young farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Shekainah Group

texts.en:
Fungai  is a hardworking woman of thirty five years.  She is  married  with two small children.  Fungai resides in Budiriro,a high density surburb of Harare.
Fungai is a member of Shekainah group. She is the one standing on the right side in the group photo.  Fungai sells household hardware and builders hardware at Mbare market. She sells locks, windows, doors, hinges and plumbing tools. She has been doing this business for the  past two years. However the hardware business is not operating at its level due to low customer demand in Mbare. The sales are very low comparing to other markets especially in town. Fungai was also selling clothing from 2008 to June 2013 .The clothing business failed and she has been concentrating on hardware. It is her wish to resume her clothing business and to relocate her hardware business. She would like to rent a shop in town so as to realize more sales. Earning more income will help her grow her business and  creating employment in her community.

loans.use: To expand her range of goods and relocate her business

loans.name: Ciro

texts.en:
Ciro is a farmer who lives with his wife in a 16-sq meter house, in a remote village called San Juan Zaragoza (Mexico). His house did not have minimum living conditions because the lack of the traditional electricity service among others. A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, improves the habitability with 4 hours of electrical lighting and the possibility of connecting other little devices that they could not use before. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Hernan is a young farmer from a rural community of the State of Oaxaca without connection the national grid. The lack of traditional electricity service in his house made him go on almost-20-km journeys to charge his mobile phone once or twice a week. A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house can charge his phone daily, as well as give additional hours of lighting, and prevents Hernan from traveling long distances. 
Funding is asked for financing the 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Arcelita

texts.en:
Arcelita  manages a farm, planting and harvesting vegetables to sell in the local community, while her husband works in a bakery to earn a living. 

For more than five years, she has sustained her business and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. Improving her plot of garden is easier with her access to GDMPC. To buy seedlings and fertilizer, she took a new loan recently.

In the future, Arcelita wants to  improve her house and the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en:
Julie Ann is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business for her food vending business.

Julie Ann has been in this business for two years. She earns more income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Azucena requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Azucena would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rootcrops and banana business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of root crops and bananas to sell. In the future, Geraldine would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of root crops and bananas to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a recurring client of Yehu microfinance. She says thanks for the previous loan as she was able to expand her business and increase her monthly profits.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for sale. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Takwirira Group

texts.en: Devine aged 30years is a member of Takwirira Group. She resides in a high density area in Harare. She is a hairdresser. She started hairdressing when she was a teenager and it has become her source of livelihood. Devine has always had dreams of growing her business by buying more equipment for her business and moving to better and bigger premises as her clientele is increasing. Currently she is operating in a small roadside wooden cabin. She also aspires to train other young women who want to do hairdressing. The money she earns has empowered her and she is now able to contribute financially to her family’s upkeep, she now pays school fees for her brother. She is looking forward to growing her business and grow as a business woman with her loan from Thrive.

loans.use: To expand her hair-dressing salon.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is an Oaxaca farmer who supports his large family of 6 members. They live in a very small house, which is located in a remote village that has not access to electrification through power lines. The installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, overcomes the lack of traditional electrification, by providing this family a basic lighting service which can be used for extending their daily tasks. 

Funding is asked for financing the 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Tereso

texts.en:
Tereso is an Oaxaca farmer who lives in the remote village of San Juan Zaragoza. When he did not have electricity service at home, he spent many alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers, lanterns. Now he has installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house that includes 3 electrical lamps (Tereso holds one in his hand in the picture) which provides 4 hours of light every day. With those additional hours of lighting he can easily cook and have dinner.
Funding is asked for financing the 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is an old man who lives with his wife and two children, all together in a poor 25-sqm house located in an Oaxaca village that is not planned to be electrified by means of grid extension. But now Simon has the chance of using a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house to have 4 hours of electrical lighting so as to cook and have dinner easily. 
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that Simon pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To have a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is a teacher who lives with her parents in the remote village of San Juan Zaragoza (Mexico). The remoteness of this community makes it very difficult to extend the power lines to her home, so she did not have light at home until the recent installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS. With the power generated by that SSHS Noemi can charge her mobile phone that she uses a lot, as well as her old parents can use the additional hours of light they have now for reading, cooking, having dinner easily…
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this young woman pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in her house.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is an Oaxaca farmer who lives alone in the remote village of San Juan Zaragoza. When he did not have electricity service at home, he used many alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers, and lanterns when he wanted read by night. Now, he has installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house that includes 3 electrical lamps which provides 4 hours of light every day. With those additional hours of lighting Joel can easily read.
Funding is asked for financing 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.en:
Maria Esther is a housewife who lives with his husband and 3 children in a little community of the State of Oaxaca, one of the poorest of Mexico where the power lines do not run to the smallest villages. A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in Maria Esther’s house provides 4 additional hours of lighting which will allow her children to do their homework.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this woman pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: fTo pay for a PV system installed in her house

loans.name: Filogonio

texts.en:
Filogonio lives with his wife in San Juan Zaragoza, a small village without traditional electrification and out of grid extension plans. In the picture, he is in front of the Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house. With that SSHS Filogonio and his wife have, for the first time, electrical lighting in their house to cook or to light their house while having dinner, as well as the chance of connecting a radio. 
Funding is asked for financing the 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 68 years old and widowed with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, cereals, etc. 

Cresencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lucino

texts.en:
Lucino, in the picture with some of his neighbors from San Juan Zaragoza such as Noemi and Tereso, is a farmer who lives in that Mexican village without access to traditional electrification. He thinks that he and his wife must have  basic electrical lighting at home. Lucino decided to install a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in order to use the generated electricity for illuminating his house by night.
Funding is asked for financing the 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this old farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es una persona que se esta esforzando para poder ser una profesional exitosa que pueda ayudar a las demás personas que necesiten de su servicio. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Fatima is a person who is striving to be a successful professional that can help other people who need her services.  She states that her last loan was used to pay her tuition.  She is seeking this loan to also pay her current tuition bills so that she can continue studying as she has been.

loans.use: to pay her college tuition.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel tiene 23 años actualmente está en el sexto año de la carrera de veterinario, comenta que sus aspiraciones del futuro son la de terminar sus estudios y formar una veterinaria propia.
Una vez culminada la carrera quiere ser un profesional útil que pueda ayudar a las personas y en especial a sus mascotas queridas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma estar cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Joel is 23 years old and is currently in his sixth year of veterinary school. He says his goals for the future are to finish his studies and to have his own veterinary office. 

Once he finishes his studies, he wants to be a professional that is useful and helpful to people, and especially to their dear pets. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his university tuition, and this way be closer to his goal.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique está en el 2do año de la carrera de ingeniería química, el próximo año recibe el título de técnico superior de laboratorio y con 2 años más de la carrera estaría siendo Ingeniero Químico.
Se está esforzando para poder ser alguien en la vida, ya que quiere sentirse útil y retribuir a su familia todo lo que invirtieron por el.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar sus materiales de estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Enrique is in the second year of his chemical engineering degree.  Next year, he will receive the title of Senior Lab Technician, and in two years, he will be a chemical engineer.  He is striving to be someone in life because he wants to feel useful and give back to his family for all that they invested in him.  

He is seeking this loan to purchase his school supplies.  He is grateful for this loan because it will enable him to continue with his studies.

loans.use: purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
El Señor Silvino , es paraguayo, soltero, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo. Es empleado y trabaja como docente de Horas Cátedras, y está cursando el quinto año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Educación.
Pide este préstamo para los  pagos de cuotas pendientes para así poder cancelar su deuda y ser un profesional. Esta luchando por crecer y mejorar no solo como profesional, sino también como persona.
texts.en: Silvino is a single man from Paraguay who works and attends school at the same time.  He works as a teacher's assistant and is in the fifth year of his degree in science education.  He is seeking this loan to pay his outstanding tuition so that he can pay off his debt and be a professional.  He is striving to grow and improve not only as a professional, but as a person as well.

loans.use: pay his college tuition.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more packs of foods like tempura, fish balls, etc., to sell for her food vending business.

Fely has been in this business for 16 years. She earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more packs of foods like tempura, fish balls, etc., to sell

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 28 years old and married.

Gertrudes works hard to provide for her family. For the past six years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income from selling purified drinking water. 

Gertrudes is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. She has previously borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF. Gertrudes aspires to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, es de la ciudad de San Pedro, comenta que por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Se está esforzando para poder crecer no solo como profesional, sino también como persona.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula, y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
David is studying to be an accountant.  He is from San Pedro and he states that he wants to use his career to help his family and loved ones.  He is striving in order to grow not only as a professional but also as a person.

He is seeking this loan to pay his tuition.  He is grateful for this opportunity that will allow him to continue with his studies.

loans.use: pay his college tuition.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres de Fe, ya que ellas tienen la fe y esperanza de que por medio del grupo podrán ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de cada una de ellas. Están empezando a trabajar, ya que están en su primer ciclo, con muchas expectativas.
Elva es una de ellas, una humilde señora que se dedica a la venta de plantas y planteras, y por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora, que desea capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, para poder ofrecer lo mejora a su familia.
Elva pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de plantas y planteras, de manera a poder tener una mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Todas están contentas por esta oportunidad que reciben para poder ir mejorando sus vidas.
texts.en:
The group is called "Mujeres de Fe" (Women of Faith) because they have hope and faith that through this group they will be able to improve their living conditions.  They are in their first cycle, and they are starting to work with have high expectations.

Elva is one of them.  She is a humble woman who works selling plants and planters.  Through this work, she is able to help her family and her loved ones.  She is a very hardworking woman, and above all else, she is an entrepreneur who wants to train herself and improve her living conditions so that she can give her family the best.

Elva is seeking this loan to purchase plants and planters so that she can have a greater variety of products for her customers.  They are all happy for this opportunity that they are receiving to improve their lives.

loans.use: purchase plants and planters.

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es: Omaira de 51 años de edad es estilista, en su oferta de servicios se encuentra el corte de cabello, tinturado, alisado y tratamientos capilares que a su clientela les gusta mucho, porque los realiza con calidad. Desde muy niña le gustó la belleza y el maquillaje, por eso después de la separación de su esposo, acudió a las técnicas aprendidas para generar nuevos ingresos y aumentar el bienestar de su hogar,  conformado por 4 hijos hoy en las edades de 19 a 30 años.  Ofrece servicios desde su punto de contacto ubicado en su vivienda y también a domicilios, durante todos los días trabajando desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su meta es continuar equipando su negocio surtirlo con productos de belleza comprados en mayor volumen y finalmente lograr no depender de sus hijos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 1 vitrina y productos de belleza con la cual surtirlos, así como una máquina para cortar cabello.
texts.en: Omaira, who is 51-years old, is a hair stylist.  Among the services she offers are hair cuts, coloring, straightening and treatments.  Her clientele likes her services a lot because Omaira offers quality services.  Since she was a little girl, Omaira has liked beauty and makeup.  And so, after she separated from her husband, Omaira turned to the techniques she had learned to generate a new income and increase her household's well-being.  Her family is made up of four children, who are now between 19 and 30 years old.  Omaira offers her services from her point of contact, located in her home, as well as in her clients' homes.  She works everyday from 10:00am until 7:00pm.  Omaira's goal is to continue outfitting her business by stocking it with beauty products purchased in greater quantities so she can finally not depend on her children.  Omaira is currently requesting a Credikiva, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it, she will purchase one display case and beauty products with which to fill it.  She will also purchase a machine for cutting hair.

loans.use: to purchase one display cabinet and beauty products.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice operates a beauty salon. Her major challenge is that her business is seasonal. 

Beatrice appreciates the support that she received through a previous loan. She is currently requesting another loan to purchase a second dryer for the salon.  Beatrice dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer and supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Ndanatsei is a member of Ebenezer group. She stays in Budiriro, Harare. She is a 36 year old woman who is in the business of selling clothes. Ndanatsei started her clothing business in 2008, after realizing that looking after a big family on a salary was not working out for her. She started her business selling women’s footwear and tracksuits. She is a member of a ROSCA group. 

In 2012 Ndanatsei heard about Thrive from another cross border trader on the bus. She got a loan from Thrive which helped her business. Ndanatsei is now currently getting a 3rd loan from Thrive microfinance and credits the loans and trainings for her growth in business. After the death of her mother in 2013, she inherited 5 young school going children on top of the five dependants she already has. Ndanatsei appreciates that working hard has helped her cater for the large family looking up to her for their education and livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tracksuits for resale.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre que toda su vida ha tratado de encontrar oportunidades para salir adelante y ser independiente, ha tenido negocios de restaurante, bares y cafeterías a lo largo de su experiencia; pero hoy en día se siente demasiado cansado para todo el movimiento que se necesita en estos negocios.
Por esta razón viene dedicándose al alquiler de algunas propiedades como locales que tiene a su nombre y de esta manera es que se gana la vida.
Vive con su esposa ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya tienen su propia familia.
Es un hombre muy trabajador y persistente, manifiesta que no le gusta sentirse inútil.
Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar algunas mejoras a uno de los apartamentos que actualmente alquila ya que así podrá ofrecerlo mucho más fácil y los clientes se interesaran mas en el apartamento.
texts.en:
Francisco has spent his entire life seeking opportunities to get ahead and achieve independence. He lives with his wife, but their children are grown and have their own families. 

Francisco has run a variety of businesses in his career: a restaurant, bars, and cafes. Today, however, he feels he can no longer spend all his time running around, which is a necessity in the food service industry. Francisco is therefore trying to earn a living by renting several properties that he owns. 

Francisco is very industrious and tenacious, and says he doesn't like feeling like he's expendable. He is applying for a loan in order to make improvements to the apartments that he currently rents. These renovations will allow him to offer much more to prospective tenants and generate greater interest in the apartments.

loans.use: to make improvements to an apartment he owns so he can rent it.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorena is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Lorena has an electronic repair shop business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her electronic repair shop.

Lorena has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Lorena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her electronic repair shop.

loans.name: Severiano

texts.en:
Severiano, in the picture with an oil lamp he used to light his house by night, is an 80-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and son in a very small house in a remote community of the Mexican State of Oaxaca, without access to the conventional electrification by means of power lines. The installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, which includes 3 electric lamps giving 4 hours of lighting daily, helps Severiano save on lighting elements such as oil lamps that may be hazardous.
Funding is asked for financing the 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that he pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Epigmenia

texts.en:
Epigmenia, in the picture with some of her neighbors from La Concepcion, is a farmer who lives alone in that Mexican village without access to traditional electrification. Epigmenia thinks it is important to have basic electrical lighting at home, thus she decided to install a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in order to use the generated electricity for illuminating his house by night.
Funding is asked to finance 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this old woman pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in her house.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben lives alone in an isolated house where he makes hammocks. His house is in a remote community of the Mexican State of Oaxaca without access to the national grid power lines. The Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that he has installed recently in his house after having been trained in its use (he is showing the corresponding certificate in the picture) gives 4 hours of electrical lighting that he can use to extend his activity of making hammocks.
Funding is asked for financing 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this artisan pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife. They like listening to the radio in order to mitigate their loneliness because their house is in a remote location of the State of Oaxaca (Mexico). Before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in their house they did not have access to a basic electricity service and now, they can connect a radio to that SSHS as well as use their 3 new lamps for 4 hours daily for cooking, for example.
Funding is asked for financing 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es soltero pero tiene dos hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Carlos es contador y quiere un credito para comprar una maquina fotocopiadora De esa manera podrá ampliar los servicios que ofrece y así ganará más dinero Carlos es la unica fuente de ingresos para sus hijos por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Carlos is single but he has two children. He lives in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement for which he pays rent. 

Carlos is an accountant and he wants a loan to purchase a photocopy machine. In this way, he will be able to increase the services that he offers and so will make more money. Carlos is the only source of income for his children. Because of this, he needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Cuando Fredy recibió su anterior credikiva lo invirtió en mercancia navideña y generó nuevos ingresos. su capital mejoró así como sus ventas y sus utilidades. Fredy dice a sus financiadores : Muchas gracias por este apoyo, he progresado mucho mas ; me siento mas preparado en mi negocio y en mi vida" En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, pues requiere comprar un juego inflable para deleitar los dias recreativos de los niños y aumentára mucho mas sus ingresos, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
When Fredy received his previous Kiva loan, he invested it in Christmas merchandise and generated a new income. His capital improved as did his sales and his earnings. Fredy says to his financiers: “Thank you very much for this support. I have progressed a lot more. I feel more prepared in my business and in my life.” 

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan. He needs to purchase an inflatable to make the children’s recreational days delightful and he will increase his income much more, making his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase an inflatable.

loans.name: Felix Felipe

texts.en:
Felix Felipe is a 35-year-old farmer who lives with his three girls (his wife and two little daughters) in an isolated house of Oaxaca (Mexico). They did not have access to an electricity service until he installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in their house. Now they have 3 electric lamps which can operate daily for 4 hours, so they can cook or have dinner, as well as read or do the homework. 
Funding is asked for financing 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Heron

texts.en:
Heron is an Oaxaca farmer who supports his large family of 6 members. They live in a very small house, which is located in a remote village that has no access to electrification through power lines. The installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, of which he is taking some devices in the picture, overcomes the lack of traditional electrification, by providing this family a basic lighting service which can be used for having dinner or extending their daily tasks. 
Funding is asked to finance 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.en:
Rigoberto has a very large family of 8 members. Because they did not have electrical light at home due to the isolation and dispersion of the houses in their community they spent a lot of money on other light sources.  With the Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that he has recently installed in his house, Rigoberto’s family saves on energy costs because they have 3 electric lamps which provide daily 4 hours of light each.
Funding is asked to finance 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Reynel

texts.en:
Reynel is a farmer who did not have traditional electrical light at home due to the remoteness of the community where he lives in the State of Oaxaca (Mexico). The installation of the Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that he is showing in the picture, makes possible both an efficient lighting for a few hours by night so as to work on his daily tasks longer. Also, he can connect a radio to mitigate his isolation.

Funding is asked to finance 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.en:
Hipolito shows a device of his new Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that he has recently installed in his house. He is a 58-year-old farmer who lives with his wife in an isolated community of Oaxaca (Mexico) that has not access to the national grid power lines. The SSHS includes 3 lamps which provide daily 4 hours each and facilitate daily tasks such as cooking or having dinner.
Funding is asked to finance 60% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is an 82-year-old farmer who lives with his son, a carpenter, in a remote community of Oaxaca without access to the national grid power lines. They spent a lot money on buying diesel for their oil lamps, the lighting elements that they had before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in their house. Now, they have a basic electricity service that provides additional hours of lighting and makes saving money on alternative energy elements such as the oil lamps.
Funding is asked to finance 60% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that he pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is a farmer who lives alone in a poor house located in an Oaxaca village that is not planned to be electrified by means of grid extension. Now, Guillermo has the chance of using a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house to have some hours of electrical lighting that prevent burning wood (ocote), which Bonifacio knows is health damaging and wanted to avoid for so long.
Funding is asked to finance 68% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: Rat’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Rat makes a living as a civil servant and working as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vimba Newako Group

texts.en:
Emeliy is a member of the Vimba Newako group (translated trusting in your kins). The group is strong and has been doing a couple of projects together since 2008; these include herbal gardens and a rotating savings club that started off as a support group. 

This loan will help boost their various businesses. Emeliy is a 41 year old divorcee with 2 school going dependents. She runs a tuckshop at her late father’s house where she stays with her elderly mother. Her customers are mainly from her neighborhood and from the nearby police camp and school. This loan will assist her in restocking her tuck-shop and increase her capacity to buy more maize for resale in Harare. The profits from the loan will enable her to increase her capacity to take care of her dependents and her elderly mother as well as other new upcoming business opportunities. Emeliy is a leader in the group and she has been instrumental in promoting self-help ideas within her community.

loans.use: To re-stock her tuckshop and buy maize in bulk.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia owns and operates their farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. For more than eleven years, she has sustained their farm and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. Improving their farm is her goal for she wants to ensure a better source of income in the future. To purchase fertilizer for this cropping season, she took a new loan from GDMPC.

Her hope and dream is to improve her living situation and save a portion of her profit for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer operates a general store while his wife works abroad. Elmer has worked for many years in this business, and was able to provide for the needs of his four children and entire family as well. He has successfully repaid his previous loans used for his business. 

Elmer now needs additional capital to improve his business. With his new loan, he will purchase additional grocery goods to sell in his general store.  In the future, Elmer wants to improve the family's general living standard.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Vester

texts.en:
Vester is 44 years old and lives in Kapiri Mposhi District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops.

Vegetable gardening is big business for many rural farmers in Zambia’s Central Province. Vester grows vegetables on his small farm to sell at one of the roadside markets. Last season he grew onions, tomatoes, and fresh greens. With the profits he was able to pay the school fees for his 4 children. 

Because it is the dry season in Zambia, water needs to be applied to the crops regularly, often brought to the garden by buckets from a nearby well or stream. A water pump would significantly reduce Vester’s need for labour and allow him to further expand his gardens.

Rent to Own has worked with Vester to create a business plan for this gardening season and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides technical training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off his loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 35 years old and lives in Katete District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops.

Vegetable gardening can be big business for many rural farmers in Zambia. Emmanuel grows vegetables on his small farm to sell in town. Last season he grew cabbage, tomatoes, fresh maize and watermelons.  This season he is also planning on growing onions.

Because it is the dry season in Zambia, water needs to be applied to the crops regularly, often brought to the garden by buckets from a nearby well or stream. A water pump would significantly reduce Emmanuel’s need for labour and allow him to further expand his gardens.

Rent to Own has worked with Emmanuel to create a business plan for this gardening season and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides technical training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off his loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is an entrepreneurial farmer in Nyimba District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to help him irrigate his crops.

Lawrence has been growing vegetables to sell in the local community for the last fourteen years. Recently he struck a deal with several local boarding schools to  supply them with cabbage and tomatoes that are used to provide meals for the students. The profits from his sales have helped him pay school fees for his four children and even allowed him to purchase two cows.

Because it is the dry season in Zambia, water needs to be applied to the crops regularly, often brought to the garden by buckets from a nearby well or stream. A water pump would significantly reduce Lawrence’s need for labour and allow him to further expand his gardens.

Rent to Own has worked with Lawrence to create a business plan for this gardening season and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides technical training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off his loan.

Lawrence hopes to one day be able to sell his produce to large-scale buyers and be able to open his own shops in nearby towns.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer in Kabwe District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump that will help him to irrigate his vegetable crops

Like many rural farmers in Kabwe District, during the dry season Michael grows vegetable crops to sell at local markets. It can be a lucrative business, but because it is the dry season in Zambia, water needs to be applied to the crops regularly, often brought to the garden by buckets from a nearby well or stream. A water pump would significantly reduce Michael’s need for labour and allow him to further expand his gardens.

Last season Michael grew tomatoes, cabbage and fresh greens, using the profits to pay for school fees for his seven children. Rent to Own has worked with Michael to create a business plan for this gardening season and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides technical training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off his loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Tamilmalar Shg - Pachampettai Group

texts.en:
Tamilmalar Self-Help Group consists of five members; Amirthavalli is the leader of the group.

Amirthavalli has three children and lives in her own house in Pachampettai village, Trichy district. Her husband, Malaiyalli, is a small marginal farmer working for daily wages. 

A large number of people, especially in rural places in India, still use wood as the main source of heat for cooking, many of them using open fires. Open fires are not only inefficient but they produce smoke, which is harmful to health, and present a burn risk to children. The inefficiency of open fires results in large amounts of wood being burned, contributing to deforestation, and hard work for the women and children collecting it. 

For the above reasons, women from this group are requesting a loan to buy smokeless stoves, which will help them to save money, time and keep their families healthier as well.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Kugutakushanda Group

texts.en:
Melody is a single mother aged thirty six and is the sole breadwinner in a family of three. She is proud of the fact that she has been able to pay for her children’s education through the activities of the group known as Kugutakushanda (translated briefly as “sweat to feed”) that she is part of. This group previously got Thrive loans twice and their payment history was marvelous with Melody being the Treasurer during that time. 

Melody’s business has shown modest progression as she used to run a small business of selling fruits and vegetables along the road. When she got her first loan she developed her stall and managed to improve her standards of living since she managed to rent two rooms from one previously rented before the loan.
