During her second loan she managed to start another business of selling second hand clothes from Mozambique where she sends a sister for procurement and managed to deposit a residential stand which is now paying monthly. 

Melody will use her portion of this loan to grow her two businesses and plans to apply for a passport which will enable her to procure second hand clothes in Mozambique.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Evelyn helps her husband earn income that is needed for the necessities of her family and to finance the education of her children. She is 52 years old and and has seven children. Two children are attending school. 

Evelyn makes and sells handicrafts, such as baskets and soft brooms in her local community. She would like to make more baskets and also buy vegetables to sell, but she does not have enough capital. Evelyn would like to take a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy rattan and the plastic needed to make baskets and soft brooms and also vegetables to sell. Through her patience and strong determination, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy rattan and the plastics needed to make baskets and soft brooms to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 51 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Letecia works very hard to provide for them.

Letecia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods, coffee, shampoo, fabric conditioner and other groceries to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for seven years.  She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, coffee, shampoo, fabric conditioner and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 59 years old and has one child who is in school.

Luzviminda has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Luzviminda has been in this business for twenty-five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a shell craft business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like shells, wire, nylon thread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Maa Samaleswari Group

texts.en:
In the year 2014, 16 active ladies from village Sinapali in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Maa Samaleswari with an objective of expanding their existing business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Bhanumati, an energetic lady of 27 years sitting with her hand raised in the photo, is one of them. She is very active and always cheerful. Her family consists of her husband and four children who are continuing their studies.

For the last 10 years, Bhanumati is running a clothes-vending business with the help and support of her husband. She purchases ready-made garments and saris from a wholesale market 200 kilometers away. Her husband moves to different villages and weekly markets on a bike to sell saris and garments. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 INR from her existing business. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses, household expenses and educational expenses of her children. Bhanumati wants to raise her income by increasing the volume as well as the coverage area. So from the present loan of 16,000 INR, she is planning to purchase some quality fancy garments for selling. Bhanumati assumes that this will definitely generate a handsome extra income. Bhanumati has a dream of saving enough to purchase a bike for smooth movement and to give a better education to her children.
 
The other 15 members of the group are doing various businesses like cloth vending, general store, tailoring center and vegetable vending.

loans.use: To purchase fancy garments to sell

loans.name: Jadys

texts.es: Jadys tiene 22 años de edad y 3 años de tener una comercializadora de helados en todas sus presentaciones; Su padre siempre trabajó en esta misma línea y de él heredó toda su enseñanza y apoyo para emprender de manera independiente su propio negocio. . Los principales productos de la oferta que son sus helados los vende al detal y al por mayor, Ella hace promociones a través de los cuales hace descuentos especiales para aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos y para que la conozcan cada vez mas.  Su horario laboral inicia desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y sus principales vecinos está ubicados en el sector donde se encuentra su negocio. Su meta principal es dar apertura un nuevo unto en la ciudad de Barranquilla, la cual queda a 20 minutos de su pueblo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito, primer financiamiento que hace la a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en un mayor volumen paletas, helados de galletas, turrones etc. Con esta inversión logrará aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar de contado para obtener descuentos especiales que hagan más productivo su negocio.
texts.en: Jadys is 22 years old and has been selling all types of frozen treats for three years. Her father always worked in this same line of business, and she inherited from him all of his teaching and support to independently open up her own business. The main products she offers are her frozen treats; she sells them retail and wholesale. She does promotions on them, making special discounts to increase her sales and her income and so people get to know the products a little more. Her work day goes from 7 am to 5 pm, and her main neighbors are located in the area where she has her business. Her biggest  goal is to open up a new location in the city of Barranquilla, which is 20 minutes from her town. Currently, she is applying for this loan, the first financing she has taken from Kiva partner Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will purchase a larger amount of lollipops, ice cream sandwiches, nougat candies, etc. With this investment, she will increase her working capital and make purchases in cash to get special discounts that will make her business more productive.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of lollipops, ice cream sandwiches, nougat candies, etc.

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en:
Fabiano is a farmer in Kapiri Mposhi District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump to help irrigate and expand his vegetable crops.

Vegetable gardening is big business for many farmers in Kapiri Mposhi District. Last season Fabiano grew tomatoes, onions and fresh greens that he sold at a large market near the Congolese Border. However, during the dry season in Zambia, growing vegetables becomes very labour intensive. Water needs to be applied to the crops regularly, often brought to the garden by buckets from a nearby well or stream. A water pump would significantly reduce Fabiano’s need for labour and allow him to further expand his gardens.

Rent to Own has worked with Fabiano to create a business plan for this gardening season and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides technical training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off his loan.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a fowl run, purchase chicks and stock-feed as well as the feeding accessories

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Here's Rafael proudly showing some devices of his new Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, whose installation has changed the everyday life of this old farmer, his wife, 2 youngest children and one grandson. Now he has 3 electric lamps which can operate daily for 4 hours, so all the family can extend their usual tasks as well as read by night. Additionally, he can charge his mobile phone.
Funding is asked to finance 42% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a young woman who lives with her 9-year-old brother in an isolated community of the State of Oaxaca (Mexico), without traditional electrification through power lines. The Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, which is installed now in her house provides 4 additional hours of lighting which will allow her and her brother to study, read, cook and do other tasks.
Funding is asked to finance 42% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this woman pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: To pay for a PV system installed in her house.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo, 37 years old, hails from a farming community in Batangas. After getting married, he and his wife decided to settle down in Dasmarinas where his wife's family originates. Coming from a farming family, Reynaldo opted to sell fruits and vegetable in the city public market to earn their family's keep. 

In February 2014, Reynaldo was invited to attend an Orientation Seminar with SEED and has consequently availed a first loan amounting to PhP 5,000 which he used to buy charcoal from scrap wood to sell alongside with fruits and vegetable. The earnings from the business has helped Reynaldo and his wife to rent a bigger stall in the city public market.

Because of his efforts, Reynaldo was able to pay back his first loan and has now availed a second loan amounting to PhP 7,000. Of which, he plans to invest in buying additional stocks of banana varieties, coconut and other fruits that are in season which are highly demanded by his customers. 

Reynaldo and his wife works hard from 6:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. everyday to make sure that they will be able to fulfill the needs of their family including the school expenses of their eldest son. Reynaldo also saves from his earnings to be able to buy a television set for his children.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of bananas, coconut and other fruits in season which are demanded in his stall.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en: Maria Teresa lives in a community in the Department of Intibucá Honduras. She and her family dependent of temporal incomes as a result of her work in the field. She is 33 years old, lives with her husband and three children, her husband is a farmer too, and they work together. It is clear that Maria Teresa works hard to maintain her family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity. She has three kids that attend school and, she thinks education is very important for their future and wishes her children have better illumination to complete homework once the sun has set. she tell us that sometimes her children can´t finish homework because of the lack of light (they only use kerosene lamps now) and also she knows how this can affect their vision. The family wishes to spend more time together, extending the light hours so spend quality time.  Maria Teresa is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to substitute the use of kerosene lamps and firewood, in order to reduce expenses and improve the family economy and health

loans.name: Ademir

texts.es: Ademir esta casado tiene un hijo y vive con sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz Ademir vive en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a su padre Ademir se dedica a conductor de taxi y necesita un credito para reparar el motor de su vehiculo Ademir es el unico miembro de la familia que colabora en la economia familiar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Ademir is married and has a son. He lives with his parents in the city of La Paz. Ademir lives in a brick and cement house that belongs to his father. Ademir is a taxi driver, and he needs a loan to repair his vehicle's motor. Ademir is the only member of his family who contributes to the family finances. Because of this he needs your help.

loans.use: repair his vehicle's motor.

loans.name: Margarita De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITA DE COLLPANI” iniciará el vigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, elaboración de calzados, taller de costura, tieneda de lubricantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, a quien apoyaba en su negocio, ella cuenta que con el crédito que sacó en Pro Mujer emprendió un negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que la capacitación y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The community bank "Margarita de Collpani" will start its twentieth term with Pro Mujer as part of the regional branch of Collpani. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors with Hilaria as the president. Its members run a wide variety of businesses, including food sales, shoe making, a sewing shop, and a lubricants store.

The loan will benefit the members' small businesses, including Hilaria's. She joined Pro Mujer ten years ago at the invitation of a consultant who came to visit her at home. She currently runs a business selling food, which she learned from her mother who supports her work. She relies on the credit she took out from Pro Mujer to launch an independent business.

The loan she is currently requesting is to expand her capital through the purchase of groceries at wholesale. She will get them from the various vendors in the city of El Alto, and then after cooking, she will sell from her sales location. This work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is single and has two children.

When asked what she liked best about Pro Mujer, she said she liked the training and the health clinic that the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase groceries at wholesale

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un aguerrido habitante del municipio del Carmen de Viboral dedicado a prestar el servicio de transporte y acarreo de materiales y mercancías en un corre tirado por un caballo.
Toda su vida se ha dedicado a este oficio y siempre procura por cuidar a sus animales de la mejor manera ya que llegan a convertirse en los compañeros de trabajo más fieles que pueda tener.
Hace poco tuvo que afrontar la muerte de su ultimo caballo con el que compartió por muchos años y por causas naturales falleció.
Ahora desea poder comprar un nuevo caballo para continuar con su labor y seguir prestando este servicio que es tan utilizado por los habitantes del municipio.
Solicita un préstamo para comprar un nuevo caballo, con él seguirá trabajando para sustentar su familia.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a courageous inhabitant of the town of Carmen de Viboral who works providing transport of materials and merchandise in a carriage pulled by a horse. 

This has been his occupation for all of his life and he has always tried to take care of his animals in the best possible way, as they become the most loyal work partners he could have.

Not long ago he had to face the natural death of his last horse, with which he worked for many years. 

He now wishes to be able to buy a new horse to continue with his job and providing this service that is highly used by the inhabitants of the town. 

He requests a loan to be able to buy a new horse, with which he will continue working to support his family.

loans.use: to buy a horse to work.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.en:
Ramiro was gathering the equipment of his new Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, when this picture was taken. He is a Mexican farmer who lives with his wife and 20-year-old son in a remote Oaxaca village without access to the traditional electrification by power lines. With that SSHS installed in his house, he thinks that his family can develop more activities, as well as extend the usual ones such as cooking or reading, because they have now 3 lamps which provide 4 hours of lighting each. Additionally,  they can connect to the outside world with the radio they can connect to the system or the mobile phone they can charge.

Funding is asked for financing the 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that he pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina esta casada tiene un hijo y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Josefina trabaja en una libreria que es de su propiedad Josefina quiere un credito para comprar mercaderia de tienda de barrio (refrescos, comida, etc) y ampliar o reforzar su negocio de libreria Josefina es colaborada por su marido pero lo que gana no alcanza para el proyecto de Josefina quien tiene buena salud y merece una oportunidad
texts.en: Josefina is married and has one son. She lives in La Paz in a brick and mortar house that she rents. Josefina works at a bookstore, which she owns. Josefina would like a loan to buy convenience store products (soft drinks, food, etc.) and expand or strengthen her bookstore business. Josefina, who is in good health and deserves a chance, works with her husband, but what she earns isn't enough for her project.

loans.use: to buy convenience store products to expand her business.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es: Gerson es soltero pero tiene dos hijos Gerson vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento pero bajo una modalidad de anticretico aunque tiene todos los servicios básicos Gerson se gana la vida como electricista y esta expuesto a caidas por las alturas que muchas debe subir en casas y oficinas donde presta sus servicios Necesita credito para comprar y renovar herramientas de electricista Gerson es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita el credito
texts.en: Gerson is single and the father of two children. He lives in La Paz in a home made of brick and cement; he lives under a renter's contract, but he has all the basic services.  Gerson makes his living as an electrician, and he is subject to falls from the heights he has to climb in the homes and offices where he provides his services. He needs this loan so that he can buy and repair his electrician's tools. He is the only source of income in his home, making this loan necessary.

loans.use: buy and repair electrician's tools.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio esta casado tiene dos hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino que le pertenece a sus padres Antonio se gana la vida como oficinista y requiere un prestamo para comprar una laptop para efectuar sus trabajos de oficina Antonio recibe ayuda de la esposa que trabaja en una empresa de limpieza pero los ingresos no alcanzan para la compra de la laptop por eso necesita su colaboracion
texts.en: Antonio is married and has two children. He lives in La Paz in a finely finished house belonging to his parents. Antonio makes a living as an office worker and needs a loan to buy a laptop in order to carry out his office work. Antonio is assisted by his wife who works in a cleaning company but their incomes won't allow them to buy the laptop so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his office work.

loans.name: Alcides Rafael

texts.es: Alcides  invirtió su anterior crédito en medicamentos genericos y comerciales al por mayor y de contado, su crédito le produjo una mayor liquidéz, aumentó su capital de trabajo y así mismo sus ventas y utilidades. él está muy agradecido por el apoyo financiero  y dice: " Espero aprovecharlo al máximo. " En la actualidad está aplicando a un crdikiva mediante el cual comprará medicinas, en un mayor volumen, aprovecando que la farmacia se encuentra bien ubicada y el potencial de clientes crece cada vez mas.
texts.en: Alcides invested his last loan in generic and brand-name medicines, (buying them) wholesale and in cash. His loan gave him better liquidity and increased his working capital as well as his sales and uses. He is very grateful for the financial support and says, "I hope to take maximum advantage of it." Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan that he will use to purchase a greater volume of medicines, taking advantage of the fact that the pharmacy is well-located, and the number of potential customers is always growing.

loans.use: to purchase a larger amount of medicine.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives with his wife, their 2 little children and his mother in a remote house that did not have access to an electricity service because of the distance to the national grid and are out of range of mobile phone network too. The first problem is now overcome with the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in the house that provides few hours of electrical lighting with lamps, such as the one he has in his hand in the picture, and connection of a radio, which is their best means to connect to the outside world.
Funding is asked for financing 60% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this young man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo and his wife have two very little children. The family lives in a Mexican village called San Juan Zaragoza without connection to the national grid, so before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in their house they did not have access to a basic electricity service. With a 5-year-old girl and a 1-year-old boy at home they had to use many alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers, etc.  Now, with the installed SSHS they can save on energy elements at the same time they have 3 lamps (Eliseo holds one in the picture) that provide 4 hours of lighting each.
Funding is asked for financing 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Here’s Carlos in front of a typical house of San Juan Zaragoza, the Mexican small village where he comes from. He lives with his wife and his 12-year-old son in a very small house, which has no access to traditional electrification. The installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, overcomes the lack of traditional electrification, by providing this family a basic lighting service which can be used for cooking, having dinner or reading in hours without daylight.
Funding is asked for financing 44% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.en:
Margarito is an Oaxaca carpenter who supports his large family of 6 members. They live in a very small house, which is located in a remote village that has not access to electrification through power lines, so they used many alternative lighting elements such as candles. The installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, provides this family a basic lighting service which allows them to save on energy elements at the same time they can extend their daily tasks, or connect a radio to listen.
Funding is asked for financing 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo is 75-year-old farmer who lives with his daughter and 4 grandchildren, all together in a small 30-sqm house located in an Oaxaca village that is not planned to be electrified by means of grid extension. Now, Guillermo has the chance of using a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house to have 4 hours of electrical lighting that prevents burning wood (ocote), which Guillermo knows is health damaging and wanted to avoid for so long.
Funding is asked for financing 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this old man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, who was attending to a community meeting in the picture, lives with his wife and 35-year-old daughter in a remote location of the State of Oaxaca, where the power lines do not arrive. They were 3 adults living in a 12-sqm house without electricity service before Simon decided to install a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, so as to improve a bit their living conditions. Now they have 3 lamps which illuminate for 4 hours daily so as to facilitate cooking or reading by night.
Funding is asked for financing 45% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta in her youth has worked as a bakery helper for 13 years in Cavite, starting out first as seller then later helping in the baking process. 

After being married also to a baker, Loreta and her husband settled down in Rosario. With Loreta and her husband's experience in the baking business, they started their own small bakeshop. Their starting capital for the business was loaned out from Loreta's father. At first, they were renting out a small space where they can sell their baked products until they were able to acquire their own space for the business. 

In 2013, Loreta's niece, who is a loaner of SEED, recommended Loreta for a small loan. The loan was a relief for Loreta in as much as during that time she has just recovered from an illness and have used up a significant amount of their busines capital for her hospitalization. With the loan she was able to rebuild and recover their family's business. 

After more than a year, Loreta's bakeshop has been stable and continues to grow. To date, she was able to hire helpers in her bakeshop to include 2 relatives and 2 neighbors. Her bakery is also operating 24/7 now. On her 3rd loan now with SEED, Loreta plans to buy a dough roller sheet to speed up her bread production process. 

In the long term, Loreta and her husband plan to open another space to sell her baked products.

loans.use: To buy a dough roller sheeter for her bakery business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth payed her first loan on time and now she is asking for a new loan because she wants to earn additional income by selling fried fries and other snacks. She will keep working doing clothes sewing and ironing an she charges by piece, Elizabeth hopes to receive additional income by selling snacks in her neighborhood.
texts.en: Elizabeth paid off her first loan on time and now she is asking for a new loan because she wants to earn additional income by selling french fries and other snacks. She will continue working sewing clothing and ironing which she charges by the piece. Elizabeth hopes to receive additional income by selling snacks in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sells snacks such as french fries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seasonal merchandise to stock her clothing store

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is a farmer who lives with his wife and two teenage sons in a remote village called Nizarindani (Mexico). His house did not have minimum living conditions because the lack of the traditional electricity service. A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, improves the habitability with 4 hours of electrical lighting to use in making corn pancakes, for instance, one of this family's means of income.  
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a corn farmer who lives with his large family of 6 members. Their house is very small and located in a remote village that has no access to electrification through power lines. The installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, overcomes the lack of traditional electrification, by providing this family a basic lighting service which can be used for extending their daily tasks such as cutting off corn kernels. 
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis is the head of a 6-member family and works as a corn farmer. Their house is located in a little village of Oaxaca (Mexico), whose remoteness means that they do not have traditional electrical light at home, so they had to use alternative elements such as car rechargeable batteries. A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in their house gives a basic service of lighting that allows them to easily complete their daily tasks.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this young man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Deepam Shg - Kodalikaruppur Group

texts.en: Given its abundance, firewood is a common domestic fuel in India, especially in rural households. Gomathi (who is standing with her hand raised in the picture) is the featured borrower. She hails from Kodalikaruppur in Tamil Nadu and cooks food using a mud cook stove that runs on firewood. Many women living in her neighborhood are dependent on similar cook stoves and firewood. Unfortunately, these women are putting themselves at the brink of contracting fatal lung diseases such as lung cancer, pneumonia, bronchitis, etc as they inhale a high volume of smoke emanating from burning firewood every day. Gomathi and the other six members of the Deepam Self help Group want to purchase low-smoke cook stoves available in the market. All these women earn a living with small livelihood activities. Their earnings are not sufficient to purchase smokeless stoves, so they are requesting a loan to buy the smokeless stove. This loan will help them breathe clean air while cooking for their families.

loans.use: to purchase a smokeless stove

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is in the picture with his certificate of having been trained to use a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, whose installation has changed the everyday life of this farmer and his wife. Now they have 3 electric lamps which can operate daily for 4 hours, so they can cook totopos (fried corn pancakes) or have dinner without the risks of fire that candles and oil lamps may provoke.
Funding is asked for financing 57% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena, 48 years old, has owned and managed for five years now a small tailoring shop in General Trias with her husband. 

Prior to having their own tailoring shop, Ma. Elena and her husband were working in a garments factory in Manila. When they settled down in General Trias, they decided to acquire one sewing machine and started to sew curtains, bed sheets, school and office uniforms. The business went well enough that Ma. Elena was able to buy two new sewing machines over time. She is also able to employ neighbors in her tailoring shop as sewers.

On her first loan with SEED, Ma. Elena bought fabrics to sew more than 400 school uniforms and was able to sell all these. Now on her second loan, Ma. Elena wants to buy a fourth new high-speed sewing machine for her tailoring shop amounting to PhP 14,000. Having saved PhP 4,000 from the earnings from her previous loan cycle, Ma. Elena only needs PhP 10,000 to be able to buy a new unit of sewing machine. With the additional sewing machine, she will be able to cater to the increasing orders and at the same time provide additional employment opportunities to her neighbors as well.

Ma. Elena plans to rent a bigger shop for her growing business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new high-speed sewing machine for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is a very-low-income farmer living with his two little children and his young wife, who contributes to the family economy making corn pancakes. A Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in their house facilitates Abel’s wife and childrens' daily tasks with a basic lighting service that gives her and all the family additional hours of productivity.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this worker pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Here's Domingo showing his certificate of having been trained to use a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, whose installation has changed the everyday life of this old farmer and his children. Now they have 3 electric lamps which can operate daily for 4 hours, so they can cook or have dinner without the risks of fire that candles and oil lamps may provoke. 
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis is an Oaxaca farmer who lives in the remote village of Nizarindani. When he did not have electricity service at home, he spent money on alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers, lanterns… Now he has installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house that includes 3 electrical lamps which provides 4 hours of light every day as well as connection of electrical elements such as a radio and mobile phone charging.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo trabaja de electricista en la sub-alcaldía de uno de los barrios de la ciudad de La Paz y además tiene una tienda de barrio la cual esta ubicada en su  misma casa. En esta ocasion el crédito lo requiere para comprar herramientas de electricista.Cirilo no quiere descuidar ninguna de sus ocupaciones por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Cirilo works as an electrician in the deputy mayor's office in one of the neighborhoods of La Paz. He also has a neighborhood store that is located in his home. He currently needs a loan to buy electrician's tools that he needs to do his first job. It's important to Cirilo that he not neglect either of his businesses, and that's why he needs the help from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy electrician's tools

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Anita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence operates a food stall business, selling from home to local neighbours. She appreciates the support of the previous loan and she thanks Kiva and Yehu at large. She dreams of expanding to a café business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she is happy for the Kiva and Yehu services.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano is an Oaxaca farmer who lives in the remote village of Nizarindani with his wife and two children. When they did not have electricity service at home, they spent money on alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers, lanterns… Now Mariano has installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house that includes 3 electrical lamps which provides 4 hours of light every day as well as connection of electrical elements such as a radio and mobile phone charging.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 25-year-old farmer with a large family. He, his wife and 6 children live in a remote location of the State of Oaxaca (Mexico) without access to basic services such as the traditional electricity through power lines. The Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in their house includes 3 lamps which gives 4 hours of lighting each to improve the quality of life of this family.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.en:
Jacinto, an Oaxaca farmer is the head of a large family of 8 members living in the remote village of Nizarindani. When they did not have electricity service at home, they spent money on alternative lighting elements such as tapers… Now they have installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house that includes 3 electrical lamps which provides 4 hours of light every day that facilitate the 6 children of this family doing their homework.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that Jacinto pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: for paying PV system installed in his house.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en:
Jose Luis lives with his wife in a remote village of the Mexican State of Oaxaca. They have very low income and had to spend money  buying disposable batteries for the lanterns they used to light at home by night before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in their house. This SSHS gives them additional hours of lighting, allows savings in energy elements and facilitates Jose Luis to advance in his work.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this couple pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam esta separada del esposo, vive en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actual mente trabaja en la Federación de Jubilados donde percibe una renta con la cual se mantiene y cubre sus gastos mínimos, el crédito que solicita es para poder comprar medicinas ya que hace algun tiempo se sometió a una cirugía de cadera pero la intervención no tuvo buenos resultados así que volvieron a operarla. Ella se encuentra mucho mejor pero necesita comprar medicinas para completar su recuperación. Miriam no tiene a nadie que la puede ayudar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Miriam, who is separated from her husband, lives in the city of La Paz. Miriam currently works for the retirement board, where she receives a salary that she uses to support herself and cover minimal expenses. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy medicine. Some time ago, she underwent a hip surgery, but the intervention didn't turn out well unfortunately, so they need to operate again. She is doing much better, but she needs to buy medicine to complete her recovery. Miriam doesn't have anyone else who can help, which is why she is turning to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy medicine

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 58 years old and married with eight children.

Magdalina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Magdalina has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Magdalina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries..

Edna has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from ready to wear.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ruth Bina

texts.en:
Ruth Bina is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. .

Ruth Bina has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Ruth Bina requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Ruth Bina has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Ruth Bina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Ramón de 47 años de edad, es un hombre humilde y muy trabajador, luchador con ganas de siempre salir adelante gracias a ese espíritu de lucha que presenta cada día al levantarse, él piensa siempre en mejorar y sobre todo en su familia la cual es su mayor orgullo los ama mucho y los cuida con gran cariño su esposa la cual lo apoya y le brinda su compañía; muy temprano se levanta para prepararle desayuno para que el se encamine al campo a la jornada diaria de trabajo, esta preparando la tierra para la milpa de postrera para el maíz que le servirá para lo que resta del año,  prepara muy bien la tierra y su dos hijos mayores le ayudan en las labores agrícolas. 


Ramón trabaja la tierra desde hace mucho tiempo, desde que era niño gracias a su padre.


El préstamo se empleara para la compra de insumos para la milpa abonos y agro químicos fundamentales para la producción de granos básicos.

Para Ramón su deseo es hacer mas milpa e incrementar su producción de granos básicos.
texts.en:
Ramón, age 47, is a humble and hardworking man. He's a fighter who wakes up every day yearning to get ahead. He's always thinking about ways to improve his family first and foremost, who is his greatest pride. He loves them dearly and cares for them with all the affection in the world. His wife supports him and is his companion. She gets up very early to make his breakfast so that he can hit the road for his daily work. He is preparing the last of the land for a plot where he grows the corn that they will use the rest of the year. He and his two grown children, who help him in his farming, do a good job of preparing the land. It's work that Ramón has been doing for a long time, since he learned it from his father as a child.

The loan will be used to buy supplies for his corn plot, such as fertilizers and chemicals that are necessary to grow basic grains. Ramón's goal is to expand his corn plot and increase his staple grain production.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and chemicals to make his corn crop grow

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is in the picture, in front of his small house, showing his certificate of having been trained to use a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, whose installation has changed the everyday life of this old farmer, his wife and his children. Now they have 3 electric lamps which can operate daily for 4 hours, so they can cook or have dinner without the risks of fire that candles and oil lamps may provoke.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this old man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 38-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He operates a butcher shop selling mainly goat meat and milk to supplement his income. He faces challenges from defaulters who fail to pay him on time and have high license fees, however, he has hopes of expanding his business into new areas. Joseph needs a loan to buy goats for slaughtering to sell the meat.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughtering to sell the meat.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian is in the picture carrying one cable of his Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that he had recently installed in his house where he lives with his wife and two little children. This SSHS overcomes the problem of the lack of electricity for this family. They spent money on candles and tapers for lighting, as well as disposable batteries for the radio, more money than they are paying now for the SSHS that includes 3 lamps and the connections for mobile charging and radio, which is their best means to link to the world.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that Fabian pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a very-low-income farmer living with his large family of 6 members in a remote house without access to the traditional electrification. They had to spend on buying candles they used to light at home by night before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in their house. This SSHS gives them additional hours of lighting, allows savings in energy elements and facilitates Noel to advance in his work.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is an Oaxaca farmer who lives in a remote village of Oaxaca (Mexico), where the houses did not have access to the electrical national grid, so he spent a lot on alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers, lanterns… Now he has installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house that includes 3 electrical lamps which provides 4 hours of light every day. With those additional hours of lighting Jesus, his wife and their 3 children easily complete their daily tasks such as cooking or doing the homework.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that Jesus pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector and his wife have 3 little children. They live in a 36-sqm house in a small village of the State of Oaxaca (Mexico) where the power lines don't run to homes. With 3 little children at home they had to use many alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers… before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, which allows savings on energy elements at the same time they have 3 lamps that provide 4 hours of lighting each for extending their daily tasks, such as cooking pancakes to sell.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this young man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Velia

texts.en:
Velia is a single mother with 5 children. Her eldest 13-year-old son helps her in the work in the fields. Before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, they had to use many alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers… With the SSHS they save and have additional hours of lighting to extend their daily tasks so as to cook more corn pancakes to sell. 
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this woman pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Gabino

texts.en:
Here’s Gabino. He lives with his wife, two little children and his brother in one of the 808 non-electrified Oaxaca villages in Mexico. When the picture was taken, he was just gathering pieces of the equipment of his new Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, which he had installed by his own in his house some days before. The SSHS includes 3 lamps which provide daily 4 hours of light each for cooking or extending the daily tasks of the family.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this young man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo and his wife have four little children. The family lives in a Mexican village without connection to the national grid, so before the installation of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in their house they did not have access to a basic electricity service. With 4 little children at home they had to use many alternative lighting elements such as candles, tapers… Now, with the installed SSHS they can save on energy elements at the same time they have 3 lamps that provide 4 hours of lighting each for extending their daily tasks and cooking by night easily.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that Alfredo pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Elsy Alicia

texts.es: Elsy de 64 años de edad con su hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica  a la venta de atol de chuco, su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene y la higiene con la que prepara el atol, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su hijo logran salir adelante, elsy está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de dicho atol como: maíz, frijoles, chile, aiguaste, etc. y continuar con sus ventas para tener junto a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Elsy, age 64, gets along with help from her son, who works and helps support her, and her own business selling atol de chuco, a typical Salvadorian drink made with fermented corn and seasonings. Her business is located close to her home, and she had a large customer base thanks to her friendliness and her cleanliness in preparing the atol. With what she earns in sales and with her son's help, she is managing to get ahead. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy the ingredients she needs to make atol, including corn, beans, chilis, and a type of seasoning called aiguaste. This will help her continue her sales and ensure her and her son's quality of life.

loans.use: buy the ingredients she needs to make and sell a typical beverage

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a mother who engages in buying and selling fruits and vegetables to supplement her husband's income. She is 26 years old, and has three children. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to uplift their status of living. 

She aims to acquire more stock of the said products to sell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy the said additional stock of various fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Being a hardworking mother, Rosalina believes that someday she will improve more of her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of various fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old and has ten children. She is married, and has three children who are in school.

Yolanda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for 35 years.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Eulanie

texts.en:
Eulanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Eulanie has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John thanks Kiva and Yehu at large for the great support of giving out loans.

Here again he comes to you requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy spare parts for use in his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for use in his business

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael was in the picture gathering some pieces of equipment of the Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that he has installed to overcome the lack of light at home. The SSHS includes 3 lamps which give daily 4 hours of lighting each, providing Rafael, his wife and two children with the possibility of extending their daily tasks and increasing their productivity. 
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new chair, an air-conditioner and a face massage machine.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Here’s Jose. He is in the access to his remote house, where basic services such as the traditional electricity do not arrive. In these conditions he decided to install a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house to have 4 hours of electrical lighting that prevent burning wood (ocote), which Jose and his wife know is health damaging and wanted to avoid for so long.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this old man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Luciano

texts.en:
Luciano is sitting in the outside of his poor house, showing the certificate of having been trained to use a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, whose installation has changed the everyday life of farmer and his family. Now they have 3 electric lamps which can operate daily for 4 hours, so they can cook or have dinner without the risks of fire that candles and oil lamps may provoke. 
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a 50-year-old farmer who lives with his wife in a small village of the State of Oaxaca (Mexico) without traditional electrification and out of grid extension plans. In the picture, he was picking up some pieces of equipment of the Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, installed in his house. With that SSHS Raul and his wife have, for the first time, electrical lighting in their house to cook and eat dinner, as well as the chance of connecting a radio. 
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon’s family has 8 members. He and his eldest son are farmer and his wife and one of his eldest sons work as tailors. With the installations of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, they have an electricity service that they did not have before. The SSHS gives them additional hours of lighting to extend their daily tasks so as to cook, sew…
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this family pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel lives with his wife, two little children and grandfather in a small village without traditional electrification and out of grid extension plans. In the picture, he is in front of the PV panel of a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, identical to the one installed in his house. With that SSHS Miguel and his family have electrical lighting to cook or have dinner, as well as the chance of connecting a radio. 
Funding is asked for financing the 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this young farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is an Oaxaca farmer who wanted to have light at home. He lives in a remote location without access to the electricity from power lines, thus he installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, that has changed the everyday life of this farmer and his family. Now they have 3 electric lamps which can operate daily for 4 hours, so they can cook more totopos (fried corn pancakes) by night and so increase their income by selling them.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo lives with his wife in the remote village of Nizarindani (Oaxaca). When he did not have electricity service at home, he spent a lot on alternative lighting elements such as wood, candles, tapers… Now he has installed a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, in his house that includes 3 electrical lamps (Alfredo holds one in his hand in the picture) which provides 4 hours of light every day. With those additional hours of lighting he can easily cook and have dinner.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that he pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Octavio

texts.en:
Here’s Octavio gathering some pieces of equipment of the Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS, he has installed in his house that has not access to traditional electrification. This SSHS overcomes that situation, by providing Octavio, his wife and 3 children with a basic lighting service which can be used for cooking, having dinner or reading in hours without daylight.
Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this farmer pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando wanted to have light at home, like some of his neighbors from the village of Nizarindani. The power lines do not arrive to that small community so a very good way to overcome the lack of electricity in these houses is to install a Small Solar Home System, so-called SSHS. The SSHS provides 4 hours of electrical lighting and prevents extra spending on alternative energy elements such as candles, burning wood (ocote) which Rolando knows is health damaging. 

Funding is asked for financing 53% of the cost of that SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that this man pays for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

loans.use: to pay for a small home solar installation

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita está casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son independientes y solo uno  vive con ella y está en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la venta de fruta trabajando por más de ocho horas al día en la calle ya que no cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo, también percibe ingresos ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil y los dos aportan para la alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar una habitacion en su casa ya que desean tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Con un préstamo anterior concedido también a través de Kiva, pudo mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ahora puede incluso mejorarla más.
El sueño de Margarita es aumentar su capital de operaciones y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Margarita is married and has three children. Of those, two are already independent and only one lives with her and is school-aged. They live in their own three-bedroom house located in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. Currently, she earns an income by selling fruit. She works for more than eight hours per day in the street since she does not have a permanent stand. She also earns an income since her husband works as a mason. They both contribute towards food, education and the payment of basic services for their family. She's requesting a loan to purchase construction materials in order to finish a room in the house, since they would like to be more comfortable and improve their quality of life. With a previous loan, also granted through Kiva, she was able to improve her living conditions and now she can improve them even more. Margarita's dream is to increase her working capital and improve her income.

loans.use: purchase construction materials to finish a room in her house.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 53 años de edad y 2 hijos adultos; Desde hace más de 14 años trabajó como operaria, en una fábrica donde elaboraban escobas y traperos y cuando salió de ella tomó el dinero de su indemnización y lo invirtió en un negocio, primero ubicado cerca a una bodega donde tenia un buen potencial de clientes, después en su propia casa y hoy en el local en el cual funciona, donde adicionó almuerzos, servicios de llamadas e internet, fotocopiaje  etc. Su día laboral inicia a las 6 de la mañana y finaliza a las 2 de la tarde , sus mayores ventas las obtiene los fines de semana y sus clientes son estudiantes , empleados y vecinos del barrio que conocen la calidad de su oferta. Su meta es lograr mejorar las condiciones físicas de su cocina y adicionar una estufa industrial para aumentar su productividad, aunque su mayor desafío es contar con recursos suficientes para lograr sus sueños. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, 2 computadores y materia prima como arroz, aceite etc. con el fin de incrementar su productividad y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Yolanda is 53-years old and has two adult children.  For more than 14 years she worked as an operator in a factory that made brooms and rags.  When she left that work, she took the money from her severance pay and invested it in a business.  At first the business was located near a small grocery store, where she had a nice potential for customers.  Later, she located it in her own home and now has it in a store front that is working well.  She added on lunches, phone orders, internet orders, photocopying etc.  Yolanda's work day starts at 6:00am and ends at 2:00pm.  She makes her largest sales on the weekends.  Her customers are students, employees and neighbors from her neighborhood who know the quality that Yolanda provides.  Her goal is to make improvements to the physical condition of her kitchen and add an industrial stove to increase her productivity.  Her greatest challenge is having sufficient resources to meet her goals.  Yolanda is currently requesting a Credikiva, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the financing, Yolanda will purchase two computers and raw materials like rice, cooking oil etc. with the goal of increasing her productivity and making her Credikiva a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase two computers and raw materials, like rice, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Lailanie

texts.en: Lailanie, age 32, is married to a farmer and blessed with two children. She has managed a hog raising business in their village for almost one year and earns a net income of PHP 3,500 for every hog. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she's asking for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase hog feeds and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to set up her vegetable stand

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salon furniture and beauty products.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 52-years-old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Virgilia works very hard to provide for them.

Virgilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Virgilia has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, milk, cereals, candies, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Virgilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Rube Rosa

texts.en:
Ma. Rube Rosa works hard to support her family. Ma. Rube Rosa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

Ma. Rube Rosa has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Ma. Rube Rosa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Virginia requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years now.

Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Phelogona

texts.en: Phelogona has operated a clothes selling business. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.  Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of  KES 50,000.  She wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Leslie es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de ropa para bebe, elaboración de joyas, venta de detergentes, servicio de construcción, venta de salchipapa, venta de productos de limpieza, taller de costura de deportivos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Leslie es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de joyería; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga, a quien apoyaba en su negocio, ella cuenta que con el crédito que sacará emprenderá un negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arco y soldadora) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que la capacitación y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community bank "Renacer" will begin its first term with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors with Leslie as the president. The group members run a variety of businesses; they make baby clothes, create jewelry, sell cleaning supplies, provide construction services, sell typical snacks, sell detergents, make sports cloths, and make and sell food.

This loan will benefit all of the small businesses in Leslie's group. She said this her first time with Pro Mujer, and she entered at the request of a consultant who came to visit her at her house. She currently runs a jewelry store. She learned the business from a friend of hers who used to help her out. She is relying on the loan that she will receive to start up an independent business.

The loan that she is taking out at this time to increase her capital through the purchase of hoops (for earrings) and solder, which she will buy from vendors in the city of El Alto. Then after she makes the jewelry she will sell it on order to her customers. This work has helped her generated income to support her family. She lives with her partner and their son.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she said she likes the training and the health clinic that the institution provides.

loans.use: buy jewelry making supplies and solder

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie lives in Sumasap, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental with her children. For more than six years, the store has been doing well and it gives better cash inflows to her family. To improve the business, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Maa Gojabayani Group

texts.en: Manorama is a married woman living with her husband and two children in Jagannath Vihar, Baramunda, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. The member standing first from the left with her hand raised is Monarama. She, along with her husband, is doing a grocery business in their locality to maintain their livelihood. Their monthly income is about Rs.10,000 per month, which is not sufficient to meet their monthly household expenses. One of her daughters, named Suchismita, is continuing her graduation in Arts in Debaray College, Nayapali, Bhubaneswar. She is a good student and wants to go on to higher studies but due to a lack of money, she is not in a position to do so.  Manorama wants a loan of Rs. 30,000. Your help will enable Suchismita to continue her higher studies, complete her Post Graduation degree and get employment as a lecturer in a college. The other four members of her group are Minati, Sachala, Kunilata and Janaki.

loans.use: to pay for post graduate school for her daughter

loans.name: Karen Marbely

texts.es:
Variedad de productos, todos en buen estado y excelente orden es lo que reciben todos los clientes en la pequeña pulpería de Karen, quién día a día se esmera en brindar atención de calidad para ganar más clientela y de esta manera su oficio prosperé. Es una mujer amable, humilde y trabajadora, tiene 28 años de edad, está en unión libre y tiene dos hijos. Hace un año estableció su pequeño  negocio para apoyar en la economía familiar, este ha sido su primer negocio y está contenta por  el  apoyo recibido, junto a su compañero de vida le han proporcionado una buena administración. 
Karen solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su trabajo, requiere comprar granos básicos, tales como arroz y frijoles, asimismo frutas, verduras, especias, productos lácteos, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros. Una de sus metas es llegar a tener una pulpería más grande, razón principal por la que deposita su confianza en el financiamiento.  Asegura que al tener mayor inventario, su clientela aumentará y sus ingresos se elevaran, lo que será de mucha ayuda para su economía. Su sueño es brindarle a sus hijos salud y educación de calidad, que tengan un futuro prospero.
texts.en: A variety of products, all in good condition, and in excellent order is what the clients of Karen's small grocery store receive. Day by day she strives to provide quality service in order to gain more customers so that her business will prosper. She is a kind, humble and hardworking woman. She is 28 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children. One year ago, she established her small business in order to support the household economy. This has been her first business and she is pleased with the support she has received. She and her life partner have provided good management. Karen is requesting a loan to increase production. This requires purchasing basic stapes like rice and beans, as well as fruits, vegetables, spices, dairy products, beverages, sodas and candy, among other things. One of her goals is to have a bigger store someday. This is the main reason she relies on financing. It ensures that she will have more inventory, her clientele will increase and her income will rise, which will be very helpful to her economically. Her dream is to provide health and quality education for her children so that they will have a prosperous future.

loans.use: purchase staples such as rice and beans as well as fruits, vegetables, spices, dairy products, beverages, sodas and candy among other things.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti, 49, lives in Kenduawatikar village, Dumka, Jharkhand. She is married and has two daughters and two sons. Her elder son is a plumber; both the daughters are married and the other son works in the market. 

Shanti is very responsible, gregarious and cheerful by nature. She is a hard worker too. She has been running a dairy farm for the last 10 years and selling milk in her locality as there is good demand for it but the earnings are not sufficient to manage her family. Shanti is requesting a loan to improve her dairy farm, so that she can earn more and support her family.

Shanti is working tirelessly towards fulfilling her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed in bulk for her cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, products for pest control, etc. and improve his land.

loans.name: Khirachora Gopinath Group

texts.en: Narmada is a married women living with her husband and two children in Bhimpur, Ganga Nagar, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. The member standing first from the right with her hand raised is Narmada. She, along with her husband, is doing a grocery business in their locality and maintaining their livelihood. Their monthly income is about Rs.12,000 per month, which is not sufficient to meet their monthly household expenses. One of her daughters named Niharika is continuing with her Bachelor in Computer Application in Star College, Forest Park, Bhubaneswar. She is a good student and wants to go on to higher studies, but due to a lack of money she is not in a position to do so. For continuation of her daughter's studies, Narmada wants a loan of Rs.30,000. Your help will enable Niharika to continue her MCA and get a company Job. The other four members of her group are Pratima, Minakshi, Pravat Nalini and Sai Kalpalata.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her daughter to earn a post graduate degree

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 36 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Mirasol has borrowed and repaid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns an income from selling rice. 

Mirasol aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita helps her husband work on their farm to make a living.
